I ended up spending 3 days in the hospital for an allergic reaction.  One of my nurses said the same thing had happened to her.  It also happened to my brother-in-law. review: im year old big guy pounds blood pressure otherwise healthy. first experience high blood pressure medication. taking lisinopril twice day days. experienced dry cough blurred vision others mentioned. taken blood pressure home times days following results: high, low, first, last, average. doctor says give lisinopril six weeks work. ill try minutes exercise days week next five weeks see improvement.
full_review: Im a 63 year old big guy (315 pounds) with 14795 blood pressure and otherwise healthy.  This is my first experience with high blood pressure and I am not on any other medication.  I have been taking 20mg lisinopril twice a day for 10 days.  I have experienced the dry cough and blurred vision others have mentioned.  I have taken my blood pressure at home 22 times in 10 days with the following results: High 164101, Low 13786, First 14094, Last 14088, average 14795.  My doctor says I should give lisinopril six weeks to work.  Ill try 30 minutes of exercise 5 days a week for the next five weeks and see if there is any improvement.

I am 34 was 20 weeks pregnant and developed high bp.   delievered my still born at  24 weeks was on metorprolol and norvasc to maintain..   once Delivered bp seemed to level out some. dr released. bp went crazy with no meds. went to fam dr. he prescribe linisopril. bp still high and increasing.  he increased.med. and added metoprolol back. headache hurt all over  hard to speak with out thinking how to speak first. hurt in upper back.stomach aching, slept alot, numbness tingling in arms and hands, gained weight, anxiety. took norvasc and skipped linisopril  headache lots better not completely gone with first dose aching else where gone. numbness lots better. no confusion when speaking no anxiety,

full_review: I have no coughing from this medicine. It is low cost and easy to take. My only concern was leg cramps. With exercise every other day they will go away. You must exercise and take care of yourself on any drug or just as a daily routine in your quality of life.

review: took lisinopril approximately five months could longer take coughing. initially tired time. prescribed take every morning. called doctor switched taking evenings would sleep better cleared lethargy. however cough never went away. violent painful (headaches feeling like ribs bruised), caused huge disruptions work, interrupted sleep, caused pee - even emptied bladder. found common side effect called doctor today switch something new. start losartan tomorrow.
full_review: I took Lisinopril for approximately five months and could no longer take the coughing.  Initially I was tired all the time.  It had been prescribed to take every morning.  I called my doctor and we switched to taking in the evenings so I would sleep better and that cleared the lethargy.  However the cough never went away.  It was violent and painful (headaches and feeling like ribs were bruised), caused huge disruptions at work, interrupted my sleep, and caused me to pee - even if I had just emptied my bladder.  I found out this was a common side effect and called my doctor today to switch to something new.  I start Losartan tomorrow.

review: dangerous drug taken market! wound & e twice within days felt like id heart attack could drop minute. gave severe pressure chest sides lower ribcage back got bad could barely stand without completely breathless! burning back pain bad couldnt sleep either lay side felt severely winded.
full_review: This is a very dangerous drug and should be taken off the market! I wound up in A & E twice within a few days because I felt like Id had a heart attack and could drop off any minute. It gave me severe pressure in my chest on both sides of my lower ribcage and back and it got so bad I could barely stand up without being completely breathless! The burning back pain was so bad I couldnt sleep either or lay on my side as I felt severely winded.

review: given medication prescribed several beta blockers tolerating well- pvcs heart block made difficult find medication helped hypertension aggravate arrhythmia. hypertension severe (generally average) started dose plus mg hydrochlorothiazide (diuretic). lower blood pressure enough bumped mg lisinopril without hydrochlorothiazide. blood pressure averages unless stressful situation. occasional dry cough tolerating medication well effect pvcs heart block. happy medication.
full_review: I was given this medication after being prescribed several beta blockers and not tolerating them very well- I have PVCs and heart block which made it difficult to find a medication that helped my hypertension and did not aggravate my arrhythmia.  My hypertension was severe (generally 180130 average) and I started with a dose of 10mg plus 20 mg of hydrochlorothiazide (diuretic).  That did not lower my blood pressure enough so I was bumped to 20 mg of lisinopril without the hydrochlorothiazide.  My blood pressure now averages 12085 unless I am in a stressful situation.  I have the occasional dry cough but am tolerating this medication very well and it has not had any effect on my PVCs and heart block.  I am happy with this medication.

review: started taking lisinopril week ago saturday, day started getting lower back pain, didnt attribute pain drug till week later. pain lower back extreme could hardly walk sleep, went prompt care wednesday thinking might uti, test negative, doctor ordered pt. next day ended er, bp extremely high, rapid heart rate, felt like gonna pass out, tests negative, doctor said new med dehydration. called primary, told symptoms having, said back pain wasnt side effect drug, symptoms body getting used drug.
full_review: I started taking lisinopril a week ago on Saturday, that same day I started getting lower back pain, I didnt attribute the pain to the drug till a week later.  The pain in my lower back was so extreme I could hardly walk or sleep, so I went to prompt care on Wednesday thinking it might be a UTI, Test was negative, doctor ordered PT. Next day I ended up in ER, bp was extremely high, rapid heart rate, felt like I was gonna pass out, all tests were negative, doctor said it was the new med and dehydration. I called my primary, I told her about the symptoms I was having, she said back pain wasnt a side effect of this drug, and the other symptoms were my body getting used to the drug.

full_review: I have been on this stuff for 40mgday 4 months now and I havent noticed any significant decrease in BP. I have to say Im ready to get off of it. Ive already gained 90 lbs, my sex drive is non-existent, I break out in hives from head-to-toe several times a week, I have constant diarrhea interspersed with prolonged bouts of constipation. Ive noticed in the mirror that my one eye seems to be bigger than the other. My hair has been falling out in clumps, I have constant back and abdominal pain. I used to be 62 tall but now suddenly Ive shrunk to 60. Ive developed female breasts and facial acne as if Im still 13 years old. Im going to my doctor next week to have him put me on something else...

review: lisinopril years high bp due high stress. last fall due work changes bp little dr. increased. past months occasional dry night cough, restlessnesspoor sleep, nightday sweats (not menopause); past weeks extreme fatigue, blurred vision, irritating either bloatedness weight gain. noted lisinopril changed months ago small white pill oval pinkish pill. physically active (brisk walk border collie, & dance times week). thought maybe need reduce back began checking symptoms. seeing dr discuss dcg - replacing baby aspirin especially reading concerns posted here.
full_review: On lisinopril 5mg for years high BP due to high stress.  Last fall due to work changes BP was up a little so Dr. increased to 10mg.  In past 3-4 months occasional dry night cough, restlessnesspoor sleep, nightday sweats (not menopause); and in past 4 weeks extreme fatigue, blurred vision, and most irritating either bloatedness or weight gain.  Noted that the lisinopril changed 3 months ago from a small white pill to oval pinkish pill.  Am physically active (brisk walk with Border Collie, & dance 2-3-4 times a week).  Then thought maybe I need to reduce from 10mg back to 5mg until I began checking symptoms.  Seeing Dr to discuss dcg this - replacing with baby aspirin especially reading concerns posted here.

review: lisinopril worked great lowering blood pressure even low dose. unfortunately, dry cough, seemed always worse night, eventually became could endure. cough ended days. addition, developed post nasal drip never experienced also disappeared days. diovan far lowered blood pressure. really frustrating.
full_review: Lisinopril worked great for lowering blood pressure even at a very low dose.  Unfortunately, the dry cough, that seemed to always be worse at night, eventually became more than I could endure.  The cough ended after 2 days.  In addition, I had developed a post nasal drip that I had never experienced before which also disappeared after 2 days.  I am now on Diovan but so far it has not lowered my blood pressure.  Really frustrating.

review: used lisinopril seven days. diabetic insulin pump. maintain good control blood sugar. normal blood sugar range. day starting lisinopril blood sugar readings. blood sugar remained extremely elevated seven days taking medication. stopped using lisinopril blood sugars returned normal readings within days.
full_review: I used Lisinopril for seven days.  I am diabetic and am on an insulin pump.  I maintain good control of my blood sugar.  My normal blood sugar is range is between 95 & 130.  A day after starting on Lisinopril my blood sugar readings were between 225 & 375.  My blood sugar remained extremely elevated the seven days I was taking this medication.  After I stopped using Lisinopril my blood sugars returned to normal readings within 1.5 days.

full_review: I started taking lisinopril in the 20mg dosage once a day.  My blood pressure started around 160-17090-100.  After 30 days and not much change in my blood pressure, my doctor recommended taking two pills a day.  Since I started that, my headaches have been unbearable.  I am going to stop taking lisinopril.

review: medication hbp months (also taking bystolic). reaction angioedema face swelled days later got hives arms legs. er doctor explained technically allergic reaction (i.e. histamine related) benadryl help swelling. given predisone also taking tylenol. told drug taken decades without adverse reaction, one day, suddenly get swelling. reaction rules using ace inhibitor drugs. bad - working really well me. cardizem now.
full_review: Been on medication for hbp for 7 months (also taking Bystolic). Had a reaction of angioedema where my face swelled and then a few days later got hives on my arms and legs. ER doctor explained its technically NOT an allergic reaction (i.e. not histamine related) so benadryl will not help with the swelling. Given predisone and also taking tylenol. He told me the drug can be taken for decades without any adverse reaction, and then one day, you suddenly get swelling. Having a reaction rules out using any of the ACE inhibitor drugs. Too bad - it was working really well for me. On Cardizem now.

review: taking lisinopril tab year now. real bad cough month wheezing take two weeks steroids heal. throat hoarse. seem swelling throat, get real sleepy, yawning lot alert mind. going talk doctor. even told son drug blood pressure. probably change medication take lower dose see do.
full_review: I have been taking Lisinopril 20g tab for about a year now. I have real bad cough for about a month and wheezing I had to take two weeks of steroids to heal. My throat is hoarse. I seem to have swelling in my throat, I get real sleepy, yawning a lot and I have not been alert with my mind. I am going to talk to my doctor. I even told my son about this drug for his blood pressure. I will probably change medication or take a lower dose and see how I do.

review: im never experienced migraines before. started taking lisinopril toprol xl result heart failure. twice month get aura migraines. seems backwards since used treat migraines. sure connected asking next check up.
full_review: Im 35 and never experienced migraines before. I started taking 10mg of lisinopril and 200mg of Toprol XL as a result of heart failure. Now once or twice a month I get aura migraines.  It seems backwards since both can be used to treat migraines.  Not sure if its connected but I will be asking at my next check up.

review: im yo male lisinopril around year, along coreg cr. coreg wasnt job completely pc dr. added lisinoprel. dropped bp somewhat, looking making adjustments near future. ive side effects, except that, reading many reviews, developed occasional deep dry cough ( thought seasonal allergies). sure dr. prescribe, medicine seems job.
full_review: Im a 60 yo male and have been on 10mg Lisinopril for around 1 year, along with Coreg CR. The Coreg wasnt doing its job completely so my PC Dr. added Lisinoprel. It dropped my BP somewhat, looking at making some adjustments in the near future. Ive had no side effects, except that, from reading the many reviews, developed an occasional deep dry cough ( I thought it was my seasonal allergies). Not sure what my Dr. will prescribe, but the medicine seems to be doing its job.

review: working all. valve repair june. bp fine august started go up. also monitor daily. put coreg first still it. last visit weeks ago also put lisinopril mg. done thing help none numbers lower coreg. fortunately experiencing side effects. going back next week doctors play game dart board medications see put next.
full_review: Not working at all. I had valve repair in June. BP was fine until August then it started to go up. I also monitor it daily. Was put on Coreg first and still am on it.  Last visit 3 weeks ago they also put me on Lisinopril 10 mg. Has not done a thing to help none of my numbers are lower and are the same as when just on Coreg. Fortunately am not experiencing side effects. Going back next week for the Doctors to play their game of Dart Board medications and see what they put me on next.

review: suffer alcoholism binges take atenolol, clonidine, amloapine, well otc vitamins daily basis. doctors intern added prescription lisinopril mg x day) first time years drinking case delirium tremens (very nasty horrifying experience). alcohol withdrawal symptoms may times go er times hours detoxed me. like nothing ever experienced. couldnt stand without falling over, get around hands knees. would normally take cab er, wouldnt even make cab. call paramedics tune. lisinopril me.
full_review: I suffer from alcoholism binges and take atenolol, clonidine, and amloapine, as well as OTC vitamins on a daily basis. When my doctors intern added a prescription for Lisinopril (10 mg x1 a day) it was the first time in 25 years of drinking that I had a case of Delirium Tremens (very nasty and horrifying experience). I have had alcohol withdrawal symptoms may times before and had to go to the ER a few times for a few hours while they detoxed me. But this was like nothing I have ever experienced. I couldnt stand up without falling over, and had to get around on my hands and knees. I would normally take a cab to the ER, but I wouldnt even make it to the cab. Had to call 911 for paramedics to the tune of $1250.00. No more Lisinopril for me.

review: years old, blood pressure ran (systolic). lisinopril) got blood pressure. side effects noted. liver profile normal, noted tsh, ft drift little high normal. taken exercise, reduced salt intake, etc, blood pressure normal without drug. seems though ft tsh tend elevate lisinopril. noticed past months. keeping records take drug week repeat thyroid function tests see trend.
full_review:
I am 55 years old, blood pressure ran from about 150-180 (systolic). Lisinopril (20mg) got my blood pressure to about 12080. No side effects noted. My liver profile is normal, but I have noted my TSH, and fT4 drift a little high then normal. Having taken up exercise, reduced salt intake, etc, my blood pressure will be about normal without the drug.
It seems as though my fT4 and TSH tend to elevate when on lisinopril. I have just noticed this over the past 2 months.
I am now keeping records of when I take the drug over a week then will do repeat thyroid function tests to see if there is a trend.

review: taking lisinopril bp around weeks far. experienced itching sensation around neck face felt like fire first week side effects subsided stopped. believe product working fine.
full_review: Before taking lisinopril my BP was around 150105. After about 3 weeks it is 12088 so far. I experienced a itching sensation around my neck and my face felt like it was on fire the first week but those side effects subsided and stopped. I believe in this product because it is working just fine.

review: effective dose treating hypertension however experience bit lightheadedness full tablet. dose staggered two separate doses per day equally effective results minimized side effects.
full_review: 20mg was a very effective dose for treating my Hypertension however I did experience a bit of lightheadedness with the full 20mg tablet. This dose was then staggered into two separate 10mg doses per day with equally effective results that minimized side effects.

review: ive taking lisinopril mg daily since april year july endocrinologist increased mg twice daily. october started getting headaches first thought seasonal allergies sinus problems headaches gotten horrible barely stand sometimes make dizzy havent really noticed big difference blood pressure either today im contacting endocrinologist today see make recommendation something else didnt realize headaches side effect medication logged find possible could lisinopril never experienced headaches like
full_review: Ive been taking lisinopril 5 mg once daily since April of this year   In July my endocrinologist increased me to 5 mg twice daily.   In October I started getting headaches    At first I thought it was just seasonal allergies and sinus problems    The headaches have gotten horrible I can barely stand them and sometimes they make me dizzy   I havent really noticed a big difference in my blood pressure either  so today   Im contacting my endocrinologist today to see if she can make a recommendation for something else     I didnt realize that headaches were a side effect of this medication until I logged on to find out if it was possible it could be the lisinopril    I have never experienced headaches like this

review: months mg day. little dizzy first take bedtime. pressure around. random dry cough lasts minutes goes away quicker dont cough real hard. also detailed vivid dreams bad nightmares years old exercise times week lbs overweight ft. dont like pills feel much better. pounding heart rest, need hour nap hr work. nap could age related though! ill stick awhile.
full_review: 6 months at 2.5 mg a day. A little dizzy at first now take before bedtime. Pressure was 160-110 now around 130-80. Random dry cough lasts about 10 minutes and goes away quicker if I dont cough real hard. Also very detailed vivid dreams but not bad or nightmares. 52 years old exercise 3 times a week and 20 lbs overweight for 6 Ft. Dont like pills but feel much better. No more pounding heart at rest, but need a 12 hour nap after 8 HR work. Nap could be age related though! Ill stick with this for awhile.

review: bumped mg lisinopril. horrible side effects. went back felt worse. tried night, got better results. realized pink pills white. guessed it. switched solco lupin. got switched less hours% better.
full_review: I was just bumped up to 20 mg of lisinopril. Had horrible side effects. Went back down to 10mg felt worse. Then tried the 10mg at night, got better results. Then I realized my pink pills were now white. You guessed it. Switched to solco from lupin. Got them switched and in less than 12 hours I am 80% better.

review: blood pressure rather steep--like way high rule, hypertension-started taking lisinopril, day. literally didnt feel change physically, yet readings never go beyond, usually lower. im pleased medicine! great news someone like me. ive gone two cerebral aneurysms past (i wasnt medicines then), im lisinopril happy take it.
full_review: My blood pressure was rather steep--like WAY too high as a rule, hypertension-started taking Lisinopril 40MG, once a day. I literally didnt feel a change physically, yet my readings now never go beyond 13090, usually lower. Im pleased with this medicine! This is great news for someone like me. Ive gone through two cerebral aneurysms in the past (I wasnt on any medicines then), now Im on lisinopril 40MG and happy to take it.

review: began taking lisinopril months ago months, began dry, hacking cough. didnt pay particular attention first, increased, time went by. third month coughing, decided better go doctor, knew serious problem throat. one daughters put blood pressure medicine informed doctor told one side effects. much thought, considering timing reading, certain lisinopril causing problem.
full_review: I began taking lisinopril about 10 months ago and after about 2 months, I began having a dry, hacking cough. I didnt pay particular attention to it at first, but it increased, as time went by. After the third month of coughing, I decided that I had better go to the Doctor, as I KNEW I had a very serious problem with my throat. One of my daughters was put on blood pressure medicine and she informed me that her Doctor told her that was one of the side effects. After much thought, considering the timing and reading, I am certain that it is the Lisinopril causing my problem.

review: feeling nauseous headaches time. also cough annoying. medication three months thought gastrointestinal disease read comments side effects. feel better knowing symptoms coming from.
full_review: I have been feeling nauseous and have headaches all the time. I also have a cough which is annoying. I have been on the medication for three months and thought I had a gastrointestinal disease until I read all the comments on side effects. I feel better knowing where these symptoms are coming from.

review: first time taking medicine, allergic reaction, took one , apparently one took. right side lip started swell , took previous night, next day , swelling continued increase. checked blood pressure often, numbers lower i’ve ever seen. normal range around afterwards. although numbers good, take ever again. going try norvasc
full_review: First time taking this medicine, had an allergic reaction, only took one , and apparently one is all it took. Right side of lip started to swell , took it at 10pm the previous night, next day , swelling continued to increase. Checked blood pressure often, numbers were lower than what I’ve ever seen. A normal range for me was around 15099-110, 11580 afterwards. Although numbers were good, I will not take ever again. Going to try Norvasc

review: since gastroenterologist suggests avoiding norvasc (amlodipine) gerd, pcp switched lisinopril. started experiencing usual cough symptoms started experiencing last months since started taking immediately link drug. included upper mid-back pain, headaches, dizziness times, chest discomfort possibly even elevating blood sugar levels little impact hypertension compared norvasc. told doctor gerd much control cannot stand side effects lisinopril switched back norvasc. interesting see quickly side effects lisinopril subside.
full_review: Since my gastroenterologist suggests avoiding Norvasc (amlodipine) because of my GERD, my PCP switched me to lisinopril. I started experiencing the usual cough but other symptoms I started experiencing and have had over the last 4 months since I started taking it I did not immediately link to this drug. These included upper and mid-back pain, headaches, dizziness at times, chest discomfort and possibly even elevating my blood sugar levels and with little impact on my hypertension when compared to Norvasc. I told my doctor that I have the GERD very much under control and just cannot stand the side effects of lisinopril so we switched back to the Norvasc. It will be interesting to see how quickly the side effects of the lisinopril subside.

review: blood pressure started taking lisinopril. worked well bp side effects could handle. fatigue, nausea daily vomiting. process trying find better option.
full_review: Blood Pressure was 180114 when I started taking Lisinopril.  It worked well for my BP but the side effects were more than I could handle.  Fatigue, nausea and daily vomiting.  We are in the process of trying to find a better option.

review: tried control bp cardio. working anymore. finally got liso. day. side effects could come on. medicine worked almost immediately. dropped. havent felt great long time. barring future side effects.....this awesome.
full_review:
Tried to control bp of 140100 with cardio. Its not working anymore. So I finally got on liso 5mg. Its only day 3. So side effects could come on. Medicine worked almost immediately. Dropped to 120-13075-90. I havent felt this great in a long time. 

Barring no future side effects.....this is awesome.

review: taking lisinopril years change bp. fact, slowly risen years. bring doctor says due white coat effect. bp reads doctors office, work home. ive going gym years, including using stair master times per week. fire doctor? ask another treatment? normal?
full_review: I have been taking Lisinopril for 3 years with no change in my BP. In fact, it has slowly risen over 3 years. I bring this up with my doctor but she says that is due to white coat effect. My BP now reads between 17090 - 200110 at the doctors office, at work and at home. Ive been going to the gym now for 3 years, including using the stair master 3-4 times per week. Should I fire my doctor? Ask for another treatment? Is this normal?

review: took lisinopril approximately two years. developed violent cough would go away. took counter medications allergies cough. help. finally went emergency room prescribed medications. didnt help. finally heart heart talk primary care physician. took lisinopril within week cough subsided went away.
full_review: I took lisinopril for approximately two years. I developed a violent cough that would not go away. I took over the counter medications for allergies and the cough. It did not help. Finally I went to the emergency room and was prescribed other medications. This didnt help. Finally I had a heart to heart talk with my primary care physician. He took me off the lisinopril and within a week the cough subsided and went away.

review: primary care doctor put lisinopril year started immediately experiencing throbbing lower back sides kidneys, also head hurts everyday extreme coughing, stomach disturbance told doctor follow told immediately states lisinopril quoted words thats lisinopril got take that. medicine caused severe damage kidneys body digestive system kidneys hasnt since. ive diagnosed chronic kidney disease told recently percent kidneys left seen kidney doctor
full_review: My primary care doctor put me on this Lisinopril the year of 2018 and I started immediately experiencing throbbing in my lower back where both sides of my kidneys, also my head hurts everyday  extreme coughing, stomach disturbance so I had told my doctor at an follow up told him he immediately states it was the Lisinopril quoted to me these  words thats that Lisinopril so I have got to take you off that. So he did but that medicine caused severe damage to my kidneys and body my digestive system and kidneys hasnt been the same since. Now Ive been diagnosed with chronic kidney disease and was told recently that I have 58 percent of my kidneys left when seen by a kidney doctor

review: drug made feel like dying. emailed doc told make another appointment. ill.. many symptoms,, feel nauseated, weak. muscles ache. head aches. breathe good ithcy cough. plain sick dropped glutens reduced sodium cholesterol drastically. ready end drug week today.
full_review:
This drug has made me feel like I am dying. I emailed Doc and they just told me to make another appointment. Very ill..
Many symptoms,, feel nauseated, very weak. muscles ache. head aches. Can breathe good and have a ithcy cough.
Just plain sick

I dropped my glutens reduced my sodium and cholesterol drastically. Ready to end these drug.
been 1 week today.

review: id taking lisinopril mg mg hydrochlorothiazide per day many years worked well. lupin changed formulation removed inactive ingredients (much smaller pill) around july. noticed hair falling out, blood pressure spikes, fatique feeling. changed watson pills, hair longer falling blood pressure running high, headaches. sure whats best move now, stronger dose different type bp medication.
full_review: Id been taking lisinopril 10 mg with 25 mg hydrochlorothiazide once per day for many years and it worked very well. Then Lupin changed the formulation and removed the inactive ingredients (much smaller pill) around July 2017. Noticed hair falling out, blood pressure spikes, more fatique feeling. Changed to Watson pills, hair no longer falling out but blood pressure running to high, headaches. Not sure whats the best move now, stronger dose or different type of BP medication.

review: bad experience! raised blood pressure dangerous levels---much higher readings prior ever taking lisinopril. also caused irregular heart beat, blurred vision, shakiness, extreme anxiety.
full_review: Very bad experience!  Raised my blood pressure to dangerous levels---much higher than any readings I had prior to ever taking lisinopril.  Also caused irregular heart beat, blurred vision, shakiness, and extreme anxiety.

review: prescribed lisinopril due high bp. almost months since started, taking bp around. currently. im still unsure diastolic high. made arrangements see cardiologist, ive waiting nearly two months appointment. dont really know lisinopril working, due lifestyle changes made conjunction. ive month notice since week two ago, day, get very, itchy night. feels like little ants biting me. thought wouldve gone away now, seems get worse. im going speak doc asap.
full_review: I was prescribed Lisinopril 20mg due to having high BP. Its been almost 2 months since I started, before taking it my BP was around 140-160  100-122. It is currently 110-127  94-99. Im still unsure why my Diastolic is high. I made arrangements to see a Cardiologist, but Ive been waiting nearly two months for my appointment. I dont really know if the Lisinopril is working, or if its due to the lifestyle changes I made in conjunction. Ive been on it for over a month now and what I do notice is since a week or two ago, to this day, I get very, very itchy at night. It feels like little ants biting me. I thought it wouldve gone away by now, but it seems to get worse. Im going to speak to my Doc asap.

review: blood pressure constantly. dr. prescribed lisinopril immediately b.p. returned normal. side effects sometimes light dizziness stand fast.
full_review: Blood pressure was constantly 170-190 over 90-125. My Dr. prescribed lisinopril and immediately my b.p. has returned to normal of 120-130 over 70-80. Only side effects is sometimes a light dizziness if I stand up to fast.

review: i’ve taking drug week (half pill day). experienced dizzy feeling last night nap, went restroom dismay checked face mirror left bottom part lip swollen. scared much checked blood pressure. calmed down, took hot shower checked pressure back normal. today lip almost back normal. i’ll never take again. like reviews i’ve read continue eat right exercise. i’m weight overcome condition. maybe drug helped bring pressure control i’ll keep there.
full_review: I’ve been taking this drug for about a week (half a pill once a day). I experienced dizzy feeling then last night after a nap, I went to restroom and to my dismay when I checked my face in the mirror the left bottom part of my lip was very swollen. Scared me so much that when I checked my blood pressure it was 186114. I calmed down, took a hot shower and checked my pressure and  it was back to normal. Today my lip is almost back to normal. I’ll never take this again. Like other reviews I’ve read I will continue to eat right and exercise. I’m not over weight at all and I will overcome the condition. Maybe the drug helped to bring the pressure under control but now I’ll keep it there.

review: prescribed lisinopril months ago, develop really bad cough one month taking medicine. cough got bad take breaks medication get relief. finally doctor recently took it. said cough sign allergic reaction. im upset took long get doctor understand suffering coughheadache seem last. however, lisinopril lower blood pressure.
full_review: I was prescribed Lisinopril about 6 months ago, and develop a really bad cough about one month after taking the medicine. The cough got so bad I had to take breaks from the medication just to get relief. Finally my doctor recently took me off of it. She said the cough was a sign of an allergic reaction. Im upset it took that long to get my doctor to understand that I was suffering with a coughheadache that seem to last 247. However, Lisinopril did lower my blood pressure.

review: years back doctor started lisinopril like lot you, migraines gone. problem theyve returned vengeance. im wondering is, since generic, possible came manufacture lisinopril. headache free, make note company making wouldnt mind, share company name.
full_review:
Some years back my doctor started me on Lisinopril and like a lot of you, my migraines were gone.  The problem now is theyve returned with a vengeance.
What Im wondering is, since these are generic, was it possible that it came down to the manufacture of Lisinopril.  
So too those of you that are headache free, make note of the company that is making it and if you wouldnt mind, share the company name.

review: far good me. flirting blood pressure medicines time (am years old) finally prescribed lisinopril two weeks ago ran doctors visit. coughing yet, nothing really note side effects blood pressure regularly around now. hope side effects listed others show day supply great.
full_review: So far so good for me.  Been flirting with blood pressure medicines for some time (am 36 years old) and was finally prescribed lisinopril two weeks ago when I ran a 170110 during a Doctors visit.  No coughing yet, nothing to really note for side effects and my blood pressure is regularly around 12575 now.  I hope the side effects listed by others do not show up as the $15 for 90 day supply is great.

review: ive taken hydrochlorothiazide almost twenty years never really brought pressure normal. new doctor included lisinopril hydrochlorothiazide finally normal. real side effects.
full_review: Ive taken hydrochlorothiazide for almost twenty years and it never really brought my pressure to normal. My new doctor included Lisinopril with the hydrochlorothiazide and now its finally normal. No real side effects.

review: taking lisiniprol years great results. side effects minor nauseous. dry cough. coughing every day spell nauseating. feeling everyday time change drug reading everyone similar side effects.
full_review: Been taking lisiniprol for 7 years with great results. The side effects have been minor with nauseous. And dry cough. Until now I have been coughing every day with a spell of that nauseating. Feeling everyday that is is time to change drug after reading everyone is having similar side effects.

review: started drug january. primary care prescribed drug, said new market, would help diabetes kidney issues. blood pressure normal taking cardizem. started coughing issues january. dr prescribed days prednisone mucinex dm probiotics. still kept coughing. sometimes cough proactivedry. called doctor feb left ear stopped couple hours still coughing issues. prescribed another bout prednisone. went see primary care fri feb coughing issues wheezing isnt good copd. nebulizer. didnt work, hospital lung issues.
full_review: Started this drug in January, 2016.  My Primary Care prescribed this drug, because he said it was new on the market, and would help diabetes kidney issues.   My blood pressure is normal from taking Cardizem.  Started with coughing issues in January.  Dr prescribed 10 days of Prednisone with Mucinex DM and Probiotics.  Still kept coughing.  Sometimes the cough was proactivedry.  Called my Doctor on Feb 22, 2016 because my left ear stopped up for a couple of hours and still have the coughing issues.  Prescribed another bout of Prednisone.  Went to see Primary Care on Fri 26th Feb, 2016 with coughing issues and wheezing which isnt good for my COPD.  Did the nebulizer. Didnt work, so now I am in the Hospital with lung issues.

review: prescribed medicine days ago high blood pressure, running average high blood pressure strokes run family. day two three severe temporal headache itchy throat. called doctor suggested sinus medication time. taking day.
full_review:
I was just prescribed this medicine 3 days ago for high blood pressure, running an average of 13990. I am 38 with high blood pressure and strokes that run in the family. 
Day two and three I have had a severe temporal headache and itchy throat. Called the doctor but only suggested sinus medication at this time. I am taking 5mg once a day.

review: blood pressure (for unknown reason overweight heart problems). doctor gave lisinopril twice day. taking months. blood. little less beginning think need dosage different drug. far side effects.

My blood is now 140100. Little less than at the beginning but I think I will need some other dosage or different drug. So far no side effects.

review: started drug one week ago today mg day. headache ever since. blood pressure low time except middle day reason, shoot. early day evening lower. also take mg metoprolol (for years). headaches getting worse going call doctor tomorrow see try something else.
full_review: Started this drug one week ago today.  5 mg a day.  Have had a headache ever since.  Blood pressure has been low most of the time except in the middle of the day for some reason, it can shoot up the 130s and 140s.  Early in the day and evening its in the 110s or lower. I also take 25 mg of metoprolol (for years).  Headaches are getting worse so I m going to call my doctor tomorrow to see if I can try something else.

review: almost months. far bp points. sore due post nasal first week cannot sure medication something else. far works me.
full_review:
I have been on this for almost 2 months.  So far my BP is down about 10-15 points. 
I had a sore due to a post nasal for the first week but I cannot be sure that it was the medication and not something else. 
So far it works for me.

review: migraines gone year every years since taking lisinipril. also noticed start get aura migraine take lisinipril aura phase. get small headache easily controlled tylonal
full_review: My Migraines have gone from 6 to 10 a year to 1 to 2 every 5 years since taking Lisinipril. I also have noticed that if I start to get the aura before a migraine and take 2 Lisinipril during the aura phase. I only get a small headache that is easily controlled with Tylonal

review: using years found effective. initially twice day dose found taking bed day very, effective minimal side effects. dry cough started couple months disappeared hasnt resurfaced. also found urinated little less keep hydrated presents problems. effective medicine.
full_review:
I have been using this for 2 years now and have found it to be very effective. I initially had a twice a day dose but I have found that taking the 20mg before bed just once a day very, very effective with minimal side effects.

I did have the dry cough when I started but after a couple of months this disappeared and hasnt resurfaced. I also found that I urinated a little less but I keep myself hydrated and that presents no problems.

For me this has been a very effective medicine.

review: male, diabetic pounds. blood pressure issues (i ride bike miles per week). three years ago ankles started swell showing sock line morning. new doctor thought might related kidney lab tests showed low end normal.. doctor prescribed lisinopril. within two weeks swelling disappeared. seem little bit dry cough. dont know cough associated lisinopril.
full_review: I am male, 68, diabetic, 511 and 214 pounds.  I have no blood pressure issues (I ride a bike about 60 miles per week).  About three years ago my ankles started to swell showing a sock line in the morning.  My new doctor thought it might be related to my kidney which lab tests showed was in the low end of normal..  My doctor prescribed 5mg of Lisinopril.  Within two weeks the swelling disappeared.  I do seem to have a little bit of a dry cough.  I dont know if the cough is associated with the Lisinopril.

So my md put me on this med on top of the other 2 Ive been on it a few days..my mouth has been extremely dry..headache plus my bp was 8653 this am...guess what its Saturday and it makes me itch

full_review: Having been taken to the hospital for an arythemia, doctor prescribed many drugs including this one. Taking it since March 8,2016 and am always tired, no desire to do anything and am in bed by 8pm. I only take 2.5mg. Doctor says Im doing well but have to contact him.

review: within days med got blood pressure great spot kept there. additionally, migraine headaches general muscle body aches stopped! stop med dreaded cough side effect suffered close two months. stopped, cough went away.
full_review: Within just a few days, 10mg of this med got my blood pressure to a great spot and kept it there. Additionally, my migraine headaches and general muscle and body aches stopped! I had to stop the med because of the dreaded cough side effect that I suffered through for close to two months. Once I stopped, the cough went away.

review: used lisinopril years hypertension secondary polycystic kidney disease. time spent dose occasional dry cough, usually night. however, controlled blood pressure well time cough wasnt persistent. recently increased dose immediately developed severe persistent dry cough. bad taking two doses nyquil night (once bedtime) subdue cough get sleep. so, discontinued lisinopril.
full_review: I used lisinopril for about 10 years for hypertension secondary to polycystic kidney disease.  Most of that time I spent at a 20mg dose and had an occasional dry cough, usually at night.  However, it controlled my blood pressure well for most of that time and the cough wasnt persistent.  We recently increased my dose to 30mg and I immediately developed a severe and persistent dry cough.  It was so bad that I was taking two doses of Nyquil a night (once at bedtime, once ~4am) to subdue the cough and get to sleep.  So, we discontinued the lisinopril.

review: combination lisinopril acebutolol daily years, due valve leakage. bp rate without meds), combination) normal me. resting go low) without issue. works well reduce bp consequently leakage. issues stomach acid, mild ed, raynauds, occasional light headedness standing; cannot confirm solely related lisinopril, counteracted meds. bottom also taking cialis, temazepam, cannabis cracked couple ribs process. careful fast stand up, avoid getting dehydrated.
full_review: Have been on a combination of Lisinopril 5mg and Acebutolol 200mg daily for 21 years, due to valve leakage.  BP and rate without meds is 11272 (78), with this combination 9454 and (56) is normal for me.  Resting can go as low as 8646 (48) without issue.  Works VERY well to reduce BP and consequently leakage.  I do have some issues with stomach acid, mild ED, Raynauds, and occasional light headedness on standing; BUT cannot confirm that most of those are solely related to Lisinopril, and can be counteracted with other meds.  Did bottom out once when also taking Cialis, Temazepam, Cannabis and cracked a couple ribs in the process.  Just be careful how fast you stand up, and avoid getting dehydrated.

review: lisinopril miracle drug. im probably alive today lisinopril. works perfectly. say taking medicine, gives yet one excuse exercise. medicine work exercise lowering blood pressure.
full_review: Lisinopril is a miracle drug.  Im probably alive today because of Lisinopril.  It works perfectly.  12078.  All I will say is that by taking this medicine, it gives you yet one more excuse NOT to exercise.  The medicine does the work of exercise for lowering blood pressure.

review: pre hypertension years went higher doc recommended this. side effects notice bp varies much -it hit sometimes drop nite. really drop big time glass vino. definitely white coat syndrome docs lower leave- nite sometimes lower! taking debated doc -he says take it...i idea ! protect organs mg lisinopril)
full_review: I have had pre hypertension for years but then went higher so doc recommended this. No side effects that I notice but because my bp varies so much -it can hit 140s sometimes and then drop to 110 at nite. It really can drop big time with a glass of vino.  I definitely have white coat syndrome-160 at docs then down to 130s or lower after I leave- at nite sometimes 105 or lower below 100!  I have been taking it off and on and debated with my doc about it -he says take it...I have no idea what to do !  but it does protect all the organs..(20 mg lisinopril)

review: young taking couple years now. tell forget take it. feel sick headaches time. lisinopril really helped get back normal active life used have.
full_review: I am very young and have been taking it for a couple of years now. I can tell when I forget to take it. I feel sick and have headaches all the time. Lisinopril really helped me get back to the normal active life I used to have.

review: prescribed lisnopril following bp reading bout pneumonia. life healthy seperate careers much outdoor activity norm rather exception. within minutes taking prescribed dosage; broke severe sweat; developed dizziness, light headedness, dryness mouth severe case hives developed.
full_review:
I was prescribed Lisnopril following a BP reading of 14090 during a bout with pneumonia. 
All my life I have been healthy, am in 2 seperate careers where much outdoor activity is the norm rather than the exception. 
Within minutes of taking the prescribed dosage; I broke out in a severe sweat; developed dizziness, light headedness, dryness in the mouth and then  a severe case of hives developed.

review: taking lisinopril hydrochlorothiazide year. experiencing dry cough dizziness. also, controlled blood pressure. recently, coughing harder longer. last visit, doctor changed medicine stating cause angioedema. siblings experience. bad drug. research taking medication.
full_review: Have been taking Lisinopril with Hydrochlorothiazide for about a year. Have been experiencing dry cough and dizziness. Also, it has not controlled blood pressure. Recently, have been coughing harder and longer. At my last visit, my doctor changed my medicine stating that it can cause angioedema.  My siblings have had the same experience. Bad Drug. Do research before taking any medication.

review: year appointments medication combinations later cleveland clinic headache clinic mg lisinopril diltiazem mg doxepin daily years migraines per year. (used). wonderful outcome tried wean meds times. bad idea. ill probably next years. hopefully migraine free.
full_review: After a year of appointments & about 12 medication combinations later at the Cleveland Clinic Headache Clinic I have been on 20 mg Lisinopril, 120mg Diltiazem and 100 mg Doxepin daily for over 15 years. Down to 5 migraines per year. (Used to be 100yr). With such a wonderful outcome we have tried to wean me off the meds 2 times. BAD IDEA. Ill probably be on these for next 30 years. But hopefully migraine free.

review: doctor said dont high blood pressure states would like see blood pressure lower is. started mg dry cough every noticed body always felt hot put hand neck dont feel hot anymore. oh way doctor stated blood pressure drop continue use it. im remembering first dizzy felt weird months feel dizziness. ill continue use it.
full_review: Doctor said I dont have high blood pressure but he states that he would like to see my blood pressure lower than what it is. I started off with 10 mg and I had an dry cough every once in a while but what I have noticed is that my body always felt hot but now I can put my hand on my neck and I dont feel hot anymore. Oh by the way my doctor stated that the blood pressure did drop and to continue to use it. Now that Im remembering at first I was dizzy and felt weird but after 3 months I feel no more dizziness. Ill continue to use it.

review: appears working fine mg. taken daily along metoprolol tartrate mg. twice daily reduced blood pressure heart attack bypass surgery surgery beginning medications time heart attack time quintuple bypass surgery. currently age. side effects: lisinopril alone caused slight scratchy throat mild cough first, effects went away year. fatigue lisinopril alone, however-hour shift work, severely fatigued, didnt start started taking metoprolol tartrate. fall bed immediately returning home work, attribute metoprolol.
full_review:
Appears to be working fine. 10 mg. taken daily along with Metoprolol Tartrate 25 mg. twice daily has reduced my blood pressure from 150 over 80 before my heart attack and bypass surgery to 116 over 64 after the surgery and after beginning the medications. I was 54 at time of heart attack, 55 at time of quintuple bypass surgery. Currently age 57.

Side effects: Lisinopril alone caused slight scratchy throat and mild cough at first, but those effects went away after about a year. No fatigue with Lisinopril alone, however now after a 10-hour shift at work, I am severely fatigued, but that didnt start until I started taking the Metoprolol Tartrate. I now fall into bed immediately after returning home from work, but attribute to the Metoprolol.

review: ive medicine years blood pressure levels still high im medicine, exercise hours week, walking like steps related problems like diabetes, super high cholesterol
full_review: Ive been on medicine for over 8 years and now blood pressure levels still high as 170103 and Im on a 10mg of the medicine, I  exercise up to 4 hours a week, walking like up to 16,000 steps have no other related problems like diabetes, or super high  cholesterol

review: basically generally positive review, issues medication - mostly dealing dosing. originally prescribed mg lisinopril many years ago. medication taken per day. medication fine job! side effects, blood pressure well controlled. fast forward earlier year: doctor wrote prescription lisinopril, dosed twice per day. blood pressure went. simply cannot handle lisinopril dosed twice daily - even another medication like metoprolol er added mix. additionally, side effects - including nasty burning sensation chest dry, hacking cough appeared. none side effects showed taking lisinopril day.
full_review:
I basically have generally positive review, but there are some issues which I have with this medication - mostly dealing with the dosing. 
I originally was prescribed 5 mg of lisinopril many years ago. The medication was to be taken once per day.  The medication did a fine job! Had no side effects, and blood pressure was well controlled. Fast forward to earlier this year: my doctor wrote a prescription for 20mg lisinopril, dosed twice per day. My blood pressure went up to 160105. I simply cannot handle lisinopril dosed twice daily - even with another medication like metoprolol ER added to the mix.  Additionally, the side effects - including a nasty burning sensation in my chest and dry, hacking cough appeared. None of those side effects showed up when taking lisinopril once a day.

review: taking lisinopril week, doctor switched another medicine extreme throat tickle cough. help blood pressure though. went week.
full_review: I was taking lisinopril for a week, but my Doctor switched me to another medicine as I had extreme throat tickle and cough.  It did help with my blood pressure though.  Went from 140shigh 90s to below 120high 80s in 1 week.

review: long-time sufferer severe migraines, interfere life. take propanolol preventative relpax breakthough times month. pcp prescribed small dose iisinipril addition help. idea drug would helped migraines. first week, small outbreaks hives connect lisinipril. outbreak within day covered entire body (there plate sized hives overlapped, smaller outbreaks top. mouth throat began swelling, got er asap. close anaphylaxis. learned known side effect lisinipril. package warning clear enough.
full_review: I am a long-time sufferer of severe migraines, which interfere with my life. I take propanolol as preventative and Relpax for breakthough  4-6 times a month. My PCP prescribed small dose of Iisinipril in addition to help. No idea if drug would have helped migraines. First week, I had small outbreaks of hives I did not connect with lisinipril. Then I had an outbreak that within a day covered my entire body (there were plate sized hives that overlapped, with smaller outbreaks on top. My mouth and throat began swelling, and I got to ER asap. Very close to anaphylaxis. Learned that this is known side effect of Lisinipril. Package warning is not clear enough.

review: lisinopril months. blood pressure stays consistently. usually top number. far zero side effects. coughing anything. disappointed begin daily pill, helping stay healthy worth it.

No coughing or anything. I was disappointed I had to begin a daily pill, but if it is helping me stay healthy it is worth it.

review: lisinopril years wasn’t much increased sorted bp brilliantly, however within weeks horrendous cough worsened months, constant skin itching sluggish feeling well. doctors changed candesartan (reviews average) lower bp it’s hereditary, start today keep u posted.

Doctors have now changed me to Candesartan (reviews are only average) but I have to lower BP as it’s hereditary, start today and will keep u posted.

full_review: 10 mg lisinopril caused a modest decrease in my blood pressure on average. Down 5 points (or more) on average for the systolic. Not much change in the diastolic numbers. Side effects are non-existent. No coughing for me.

review: switched lisinopril atenolol appeared atenolol (taken years recent dosage increase) caused rash neck. started lisinopril mg tuesday, friday, skin around neck, ears thickened, blistered, oozing. went doctor following monday- rash still attributed atenolol. bp still high, doctor said go mg lisinopril. took another mg within hours, neck swelling, face mouth began itch. knew angioedema side effect lisinopril happened year old son took blood pressure. went er, told reaction drug. knee started hurt time. within hours stopping lisinopril, rash, swelling, skin thickening began go away. within days, skin still red, blistering, flaking, raised areas gone. knee pain gotten better actually worse try stretch exercise. horrible experience.
full_review: I was switched to lisinopril from atenolol because it appeared  atenolol (taken for years but recent dosage increase) caused  rash on my neck. Started lisinopril 10 mg on a Tuesday, by Friday, the skin around my neck, and ears was thickened, blistered, and oozing. Went to doctor the following Monday- rash still attributed to atenolol. BP still high, doctor said go up to 20 mg of lisinopril. Took another 10 mg within 2 hours, neck swelling, face and mouth began to itch. I knew angioedema was a side effect of Lisinopril because it happened to my 26 year old son when he took it for his blood pressure.  Went to the ER, was told it was reaction to the drug.  Knee started to hurt at the same time. Within 24-48 hours of stopping Lisinopril, rash, swelling, skin thickening began to go away. Within 3 days, skin still red, but all blistering, flaking, and raised areas gone. Knee pain has not gotten better and is actually worse when I try to stretch or exercise. Horrible experience.

Pharmacy is OptumRx. Last bottle showed Solco HC as manufacturer and pill was as shown on the Solco site. 
New bottle shows manufacturer Solco and pill is white and round. Stamped with 4214 and a stylized V on the reverse. Web search shows this as manufactured by Vintage Pharmaceuticals Inc.

Did Solco buy Vintage? Did OptumRx make a labeling mistake?

review: years old taking lisinopril almost years high blood pressure, also caused frequent headaches. first prescribed mg per day. lot light headedness actually fainted once. cardiologist lowered dosage mg per day. headaches virtually gone. havent true migraine since started drug. woken twice swollen eye, didnt connect lisinopril read comments here, that, ive zero side effects since switching mg.
full_review: I am 27 years old and have been taking lisinopril for almost 2 years for high blood pressure, which also caused very frequent headaches. I was first prescribed 10 mg per day. I had a lot of light headedness and I actually fainted once. My cardiologist then lowered my dosage to 5 mg per day. My headaches are virtually gone. I havent had a true migraine since I started on the drug. I have woken twice with a swollen eye, which I didnt connect to lisinopril until I read the comments here, but other than that, Ive had zero side effects since switching to the 5 mg.

review: take day hopefully prevent kidney issues diabetes. im positive drug problem recently found without medication month saw primary gave new script. seems lower bp fortunately mine really far normal started taking medication also started back feeling sick like im dying something!! every muscle joint body throbbing hurting almost beyond stand!! absolute worst feeling wouldnt wish anyone!!! unfortunately havent seen real complaints people feeling way say% lisinopril would stop immediately!!!

review: taken lisinopril two years noticeable side effects. blood pressure moderately high years beforehand, diagnosed type diabetes time. since ive taking it, time blood pressure rises normal range upset lot pain. satisfied it. us without insurance, available day supply pharmacies.
full_review: I have been taken lisinopril for over two years now with no noticeable side effects. My blood pressure was moderately high for a few years beforehand, diagnosed with type 2 diabetes at the same time. Since Ive been taking it, the only time my blood pressure rises out of normal range is when I am very upset or in a lot of pain. I am very satisfied with it. For those of us without insurance, it is available for $1090 day supply at most pharmacies.

review: took years figure causing intestinestomach damage weeks now. pain gotten better may permanent damage. wakeup morning terrible pain run toilet diarrhea. cant leave house several hours till stomach starts feeling better. taking drug pain became bad constant planed suicide. worse pain ever had. could get able leave house till around. much pain diarrhea forced retire. would drink half bottle kopectate take imodiums leave house. exhausted time.
full_review: Took years for me to figure out what was causing the intestinestomach damage.  I have been off of it for 2 weeks now.  The pain has gotten better but there may have been permanent damage.  I wakeup in the morning in terrible pain and having to run to the toilet because of diarrhea.  I cant leave the house for several hours till my stomach starts feeling better.  While taking the drug the pain became so bad and so constant that I had planed on suicide.  It is the worse pain I have ever had.  I could get up at 5am and not able to leave my house till around 2pm.  I was in so much pain and diarrhea I was forced to retire.  I would have to drink half a bottle of kopectate and take 3 imodiums  to leave my house.  I was exhausted all the time.

review: gp doctor changed blood pressure medicine amlodipine besylate metoprolol lisinopril metoprolol protect kidneys. forty day period lisinopril dosage increased stages attempt get bp results amlodipine. prior taking lisinopril blood pressure around. amount lisinopril increased blood pressure kept increasing days around (maximum). take blood pressure times per day. experienced increased confusion, tiredness, dizziness, weakness constipation dosage lisinopril increased. went back amlodipine made appointment cardiologist.
full_review: My GP Doctor changed  my blood pressure medicine from 5mg Amlodipine Besylate50mg Metoprolol to 5mg Lisinopril50mg Metoprolol to protect my kidneys.  Over a forty day period my Lisinopril dosage was increased in stages from 5mg to 40mg in an attempt to get the same BP results I had with Amlodipine.  Prior to taking Lisinopril my blood pressure was around 13575.  As the amount of Lisinopril was increased my blood pressure kept increasing. After 40 days it was around 17585 (maximum 200100).  I take my blood pressure 3 -4 times per day.   I experienced increased confusion, tiredness, dizziness, weakness and constipation as the dosage of Lisinopril was increased. I went back on Amlodipine and made an appointment with my Cardiologist.

review: migraine suffer entire life. havent week without migraines far back remember. since start, migraine every day woke sometimes migraine would wake up. quality life terrible. didnt full blown migraine back neck bad left eye felt like someone turning hot poker it, scared death would get one. go medicine imetrex, side effects terrible taking everyday almost course times recommended dosage month. felt horrible always migraine, nauseous, throwing able function. personal work life suffered. give one day went doctor got lisinopril high blood pressure. taking weeks migraine since. longest gone without migraine years. life back
full_review: Have been a migraine suffer for my entire life. I havent had a week without 3-4 migraines for as far back as I can remember. Since the start of 2021, I have had a migraine every day when I woke up and sometimes the migraine would wake me up. My quality of life was terrible. When I didnt have a full blown migraine where the back of my neck was so bad and my left eye felt like someone was turning a hot poker in it, I was scared to death that I would get one. My go to medicine was Imetrex, but the side effects were terrible and was taking everyday almost which of course is 3 times the recommended dosage in a month. I felt horrible and always had a migraine, was nauseous, throwing up or not able to function. My personal and work life suffered. Was about to give up until one day I went to the doctor and got on 10mg of lisinopril for high blood pressure. I have been taking it for 3 weeks and have not had 1 migraine since. This is the longest I have gone without a migraine in 30 years. I have my life back

review: prescribed lisinopril high blood pressure. almost immediately migraines significantly reduced, time become almost nonexistent. previously tried many prophylactic meds migraines didnt work. wonderful welcome change lose days migraine anymore. blood pressure control, dose reduced mg still working effectively migraine prevention. side effects.
full_review: was prescribed lisinopril for high blood pressure.  20mg.   almost immediately migraines were significantly reduced, and with time have become almost nonexistent.   i had previously tried many prophylactic meds for migraines that didnt work.  its a wonderful welcome change not to lose days to migraine anymore.  with blood pressure now under control, my dose was reduced to 10 mg and still working just as effectively on migraine prevention.  no side effects.

review: prescribed lisinopril hbp years ago. got prescription walgreens small round pink pill. helped bp worked well. year ago, switched oblong yellow pill. told pharmacist drug. week noticed pressure behind eyes felt meh. asked switch back pink pills said do. stayed yellow pills. moving year half ahead, ive noticing heart palpitations, high resting heart rate overall feeling myself. finally switched pharmacies started pink pills yesterday. hoping helps me. anyone else notice marked change getting solco pills?
full_review: I was prescribed Lisinopril 5mg for HBP about 5 years ago.  I got my prescription from Walgreens and it was a small round pink pill.  It helped my BP and worked well.  Then about a year ago, they switched to an oblong yellow pill.  I was told by pharmacist it was same drug.  After a week I noticed pressure behind my eyes again and felt meh.  I asked to switch back to pink pills but they said no can do.  So I stayed on yellow pills.  Moving a year and half ahead, Ive been noticing some heart palpitations, high resting heart rate and overall feeling of not myself.  Finally switched pharmacies and started pink pills again yesterday.  Hoping this helps me.  Anyone else notice a marked change when getting off the Solco pills?

review: years ago, taking lisinopril started get tired point could walk even short distance. dr blood test check heart, lung problem, cancer, asbestos etc. xray showed liquid lungs. started drain liquid lungs. lungs continue build fluids. surgery found nothing wrong lungs. liquid started accumulate left lung. panicking praying. finally, started write remember long taking lisinopril realized problem started around time started taking lisinopril. told dr suspected lisinopril stopped taking it. days weeks later like miracle felt like new. time dr told incidence reaction medical journal. beware this.
full_review: Years ago, I was taking lisinopril and started to get very tired to the point I could not walk not even a short distance. Dr did all blood test to check if there was a heart, lung problem, cancer, asbestos etc. Xray showed liquid in my lungs. So he started to drain liquid from my lungs. My lungs continue to build fluids. After surgery found nothing wrong with my lungs. Liquid started to accumulate in my left lung. I was panicking and praying. Finally, I started to write and remember how long I have been taking Lisinopril and realized that my problem started around the time I started taking Lisinopril. I told my Dr that I suspected it was Lisinopril so stopped taking it. Days and weeks later like a miracle I felt like new. At that time my Dr told me that I was the only incidence with this reaction in the medical journal. BEWARE OF THIS.

review: toprol xr weeks get quickly. horrible anxietypanic attacks, constant arrhythmia, tachycardia, passing out, hypoglycemia, hallucinations, nightmares, raynauds syndrome, etc. drug almost finished off severe panic attacks since starting it; wasnt healthy person am, certain would given heart attack. exactly weeks it. horrible symptoms stopped, except arrhythmia comes goes. opinion, toprol serious endocrine disrupter pulled market. dangerous drug. cant believe sick became starting it. screw pills. control bp diet. truly regret ever putting one poisonous pills mouth.
full_review: Was on Toprol XR for only 6 weeks and had to get off of it quickly. HORRIBLE anxietypanic attacks, constant arrhythmia, tachycardia, passing out, hypoglycemia, hallucinations, nightmares, Raynauds syndrome, etc. This drug almost finished me off. I had 13 severe panic attacks since starting it; and if I wasnt as healthy a person as I am, I am certain it would have given me a heart attack. I am now exactly 8 weeks off of it. Most of the horrible symptoms have stopped, except the arrhythmia that comes and goes. In my opinion, Toprol is a serious endocrine disrupter and should be pulled from the market. It is a very dangerous drug. Cant believe how sick I became after starting it. Screw all pills. I can control my BP with diet. I truly regret ever putting one of these poisonous pills in my mouth.

condition: Metoprolol Succinate ER (metoprolol) for High Blood Pressure
review: super high blood pressure also high pulse & physical anxiety symptoms. idiopathic; im young, slim & female, good diet & aggravating lifestyle factors. ive way since age. tried several solutions including otc & prescription medications, diet changes & hippie-dippie placebo stuff like breathing exercisesmeditation. currently im meds bp. one really miss skip metoprolol. skip ace inhibitor diuretic, theres barely difference. skip metoprolol? id better call sick. shouldnt give hoot experience; body chemistry nothing yours. body may give damn beta blockers care everything calcium channel blocker know. bodies different, different reaction different meds. cant believe still reviewing medication like one-size-fits-all deal take others advice on.
full_review:
I have not only super high blood pressure but also very high pulse & physical anxiety symptoms. Its idiopathic; Im young, slim & female, with good diet & no aggravating lifestyle factors. Ive been this way since age 18. Tried several solutions including OTC & prescription medications, diet changes & hippie-dippie placebo stuff like breathing exercisesmeditation. Currently Im on 3 meds for my BP. The only one I really miss when I skip it is metoprolol. If I skip my ACE inhibitor or my diuretic, theres barely any difference. Skip my metoprolol? Id better call in sick.

You shouldnt give a hoot about my experience; my body chemistry has nothing to do with yours. Your body may not give a damn about beta blockers but care everything about a calcium channel blocker for all we know. All bodies are different, with a different reaction to different meds. I cant believe were still reviewing medication like its a one-size-fits-all deal that we can take each others advice on.

review: getting medication brutal. took months never sicker. side effects dizziness blurred vision.tachycardia chest pain muscle weakness parathesias. getting took months rebound effects jitters sweating tachycardia random. different getting heroin. twice public side effects severe people called ambulance went er. medication lethal, least me. heard people say felt really good it??? dont know try med react. put allergy list. light end tunnel getting it. takes time done medical supervision. took months get rebound effects. feel like drug addict survived rehab made through!!! hang god bless!!!
full_review:
Getting off this medication is brutal.
I only took it for 2 months and I was never sicker.
Side effects of dizziness blurred vision.tachycardia chest pain muscle weakness and parathesias.
Getting off it took about 6 months with rebound effects of jitters sweating tachycardia at  random.  It was no different than getting off heroin.
Twice while in public the side effects were so severe other people called an ambulance and I went to the ER.
This medication is lethal, at least for me.  I heard some people say they felt really good on it???  You dont know until you try a med how you will react.  I put it on my allergy list.
There is a light at the end of the tunnel when you are getting off it.  It takes time and should be done with medical supervision.  It took me 6 months to get over the rebound effects.
I feel like a drug addict that survived rehab and made it through!!!  Hang in there and God Bless!!!

review: beta blocker rebound.....the docs tell metaprolol system days. may blood nervous system least months. thus.....there longer inhibition norepinephrine causes elevated hr anxiety reaction. crosses blood brain barrier lipophilic (stored fat tissue) stays system longer friend mine weaned drug still mild rebound symptoms elevated hr shaky knees sweating. taking drug side effects intense. dizzy racing heart muscle weakness exercise intolerance palpitations constipation flushing etc. horrible drug wouldnt give dead dog! try patient rebound effects. told eventually subside fell normal again. hope prayers getting drug!
full_review:
Beta Blocker Rebound.....the Docs will tell you that this metaprolol is out of your system in 3 days.  It may be out of your blood but it is not out of the nervous system for at least 3 months.
Thus.....there is no longer inhibition of norepinephrine which causes the elevated HR and the anxiety reaction.  It crosses the blood brain barrier and is lipophilic (stored in fat tissue) which stays in your system longer
Both myself and a friend of mine have weaned off this drug and we are still having mild Rebound symptoms with elevated HR shaky knees and sweating.
While taking the drug they side effects were very intense.  Dizzy racing heart muscle weakness exercise intolerance palpitations constipation flushing etc.
This is a horrible drug and I wouldnt give it to a dead dog!
Try to be patient with the rebound effects.  I was told it does eventually subside so you will fell normal again.
Hope and prayers for all getting off this drug!

full_review:
Metaprolol us a horrid drug.  I was started on 25mg 2x a day and only for the past 2 months.
MD said it was a TINY dose.  Nothing tiny about it.  I have been so dizzy ...blurry vision... 
So I am trying to wean off and its a miserable ride.  I have palpitations...some chest pain...I wake in the night with ringing ears and racing heart.

I have headaches, tinnitus, poor exercise tolerance.(I was athletic) in addition to the palpitations and chest pain. 
I am trying to wean at 12.5 and now down to 6.25 daily until I can ditch this horrid drug.

Good luck to all of you working hard to get off this drug.

full_review: Ive been on this almost a year for high blood pressure and an uneven heart beat. Since I started my heart beat is fine but ended up in ER numerous times for sky rocketing blood pressure.  VERY EXPENSIVE! I thought maybe by switching to the brand name I could fix it but after several months on it found out AstraZeneca doesnt even make it anymore so I was paying 6x as much for, basically, the generic rubbish. Finally, a wise cardiologist took me off the time release and put me on the 2x a day dosage of the tartrate and my blood pressure has been really good since then. If youre having any problems with it bouncing around I would suggest switching. Due to all of the issues this has caused Ive lost a bunch of weight and am exercising and on a low salt  diet. Hoping to get off of this soon.  Oh, and DO NOT take the time release twice a day even if your dr tells you to. That should only be taken once a day. Its been a long road but Ive learned a lot. Do your research.

I’ve had an extremely stressful year(s) - like bad 
2 college kids had very serious health problems while at college out of state at the same time, in-laws had major health crisis and ended up in hospital for 3 months 
I was running on pure adrenaline 247 I quit sleeping, stressed,  my HR wouldn’t drop below 130 - it wasn’t uncommon for me to be in 140, 150’s day and night.  All this happened right in the middle of damn menopause
Dr sent me to cardiologist - diagnosis - extreme stressanxiety tachycardia - I take 12 dose 12.5 am and 12.5pm (25mg)
