review: one week, side effects including back ache severe. took three weeks determine drug. complications ceased immediately upon taken drug. quit without dr orders
full_review: After about one week, the side effects including back ache were severe.   It took about three weeks to determine it was the Drug.  The complications ceased immediately upon being taken off the drug. Do not quit without dr orders

review: began months attack low dose per day smallest dosage pill) began sleeping hours day. also, seemed care anything- said inappropriate comments, pulled traffic recklessly, damaged gardening equipment. nothing seriously bad happened learn concentrate differently. three years number concerns stopped taking med- sexual desire increased erections, urine stream strong, fewer trips bathroom, care future again. said - think metoprolol helped recover began taking again, going talk doctor discontinuing it.
full_review:
Began 6 months after attack a very low dose (12 per day of smallest dosage pill)
Began sleeping 12 to 16 hours each day. Also, seemed not to care about anything- said inappropriate comments, pulled out into traffic recklessly, and damaged gardening equipment. Nothing seriously bad happened but I had to learn to concentrate differently. After three years I had a number of concerns and stopped taking this med- sexual desire increased as did erections, urine stream strong, fewer trips to the bathroom, and I care about the future again. 
With all that said - I think Metoprolol helped me to recover and I began taking it again, but I am going to talk to my doctor about discontinuing it.

review: constant afib years though mostly tolerable. times though spells usually run less minutes heart rate around plus pain. worst battle level lasted minutes. take metoprolol times day regular basis add another biggies settles heart rate quickly. luckily side affects would love find something else quickly slows heart rate ... mainly avoid pain spooky stuff goes a;long it. ive angioplasties stents since.
full_review: I have had constant afib for over 2 years though mostly tolerable. At times though I have spells that usually run less than a few minutes with a heart rate of around 190 plus and pain. My worst battle with this level lasted about 15 minutes. I take 50mg of Metoprolol 2 times a day on a regular basis but add another 50 if I have the biggies and that settles the heart rate down quickly. Luckily I have no side affects but would love to find something else that quickly slows the heart rate ... mainly to avoid the pain and spooky stuff that goes a;long with it. Ive had 11 angioplasties and 10 stents since 1990 and am 70.

review: complaint makes feel tired around noon time. sometimes ill take forty five minute nap get home work, usually feel re-energized. control blood pressure well.
full_review: My only complaint is that it makes me feel tired around noon time. Sometimes Ill take a forty five minute nap after I get home from work, then I usually feel re-energized. It does control blood pressure well.

review: taking daily around years. caused lb. weight gain cant seem shake; that, worked well blood pressure control. good side effect - longer get migraine headaches nearly much used to.
full_review: I have been taking 50mg daily for around 2 years. Caused a 25 lb. weight gain that I cant seem to shake; other then that, its worked well for blood pressure control. Good side effect - I no longer get migraine headaches nearly as much as I used to.

review: took toprolol kid type heart failure. doctor said athletes get age switched metoprolol daily. years new doctor took began jumping awake gasping air. diagnosed severe sleep apnea put cpap. never helped kept it, turned pressure wide open. still jumped awake nights. doctor beside finally placed back metoprolol two weeks sleep apnea disappeared.
full_review: I took toprolol as a kid for a type of heart Failure. My doctor said it was same as what athletes get at age 29 I had been switched to Metoprolol 50mg once daily. After a few years a new doctor took me off of it and I began jumping awake gasping for air. I was diagnosed with severe sleep apnea and put on a CPAP. It never helped I Kept having it, turned up until the pressure was wide open. but still I jumped awake at nights. My doctor was beside himself with what to do and finally I was placed back on the Metoprolol 50Mg and in two weeks my sleep Apnea disappeared.

review: svt tachycardia yrs, episode caused go er adenosine. svt ablasion told continue metoprolol-bid continue managing hypertension however pulse low advised take. today bp hr took pill hrs later feel crappy, retook hr. thinking need refigure another med manage htn drop pulse low...
full_review: SVT Tachycardia 30 yrs, episode 22016 caused me to go to ER with Adenosine.  Just had an SVT Ablasion 511 and was told to continue Metoprolol 25mg 1-bid to continue managing my Hypertension however my pulse is now low and it not above 55 advised to not take.  Today BP 15186 HR 60 so took pill and now a few hrs later feel crappy, retook 14283 HR 51.  Thinking they need to refigure another med to manage the HTN that does not drop my pulse so low...

review: always super high pulse last time went doctor prescribed lower prevent migraines. ive almost month daily. day feel tired, gross heavy feeling chest. also cant sleep night anymore. im going back doctor days try switch something else.
full_review: I always have a super high pulse and the last time I went to the doctor he prescribed me this to lower it and prevent migraines. Ive been on it for almost a month now at 25mg once daily. During the day I feel tired, and have this gross heavy feeling in my chest. I also cant sleep at night anymore. Im going back to the doctor in a few days to try to switch to something else.

review: ive third pacer put last years. first one joined bpm club. terrible. first pacer still felt powerful heartbeats. powerful kept awake night. doc put mg metatropanol ive felt like human ever since. complaint short term memory year old male.
full_review: Ive had my third pacer put in the last 18 years. Before the first one I joined the 200 bpm club. Terrible. After my first pacer I still felt very powerful heartbeats. So powerful they kept me awake at night. Doc put me on 50 mg metatropanol and Ive felt like a human being ever since. Only complaint is short term memory. 70 year old male.

review: years old using medicine high blood pressure around years. controls blood pressure gained weight, specially legs, increased urination, headache, pain chest, breath well general. better medicine before.
full_review: 53 years old using this medicine for high blood pressure for around 6 years. It controls my blood pressure but I gained weight, specially on my legs, increased urination, no headache, no pain on my chest, breath well in general. It is better than other medicine I have been on before.

review: started take metoprolol er heart attack lowered heart rate tired dizzy. take mg) pill morning, feel good minor migraine years. prior heart attack bouts migraines, new migraine daily days, month.
full_review: I started take metoprolol 25mg ER after a heart attack.  The 25mg lowered my heart rate to where I was tired and dizzy. Now I take 12 (12.5 mg) pill once in the morning, feel good and have had 1 minor migraine in 3 12 years. Prior to the heart attack I was having bouts of migraines, a new migraine daily for 3-4 days, about once a month.

review: situation bit different. suffer multiple conditions (sle, hypotension upon standing, etc.) started medicine myocardial infarction also tachycardia. need control tachycardia also hypotension issues worry about. tried beta blockers none worked well enough deal heart issues. medicine dealt heart issues caused lot side effects go away.
full_review: My situation is a bit different. I suffer from multiple other conditions (SLE, hypotension upon standing, etc.) When I started on this medicine I had just had a myocardial infarction and also tachycardia. I need to control the tachycardia but also had the hypotension issues to worry about. I tried other beta blockers and none worked well enough to deal with the heart issues. This medicine dealt with the heart issues BUT it caused a lot of side effects that did not go away.

review: ive taking daily twice daily) since heart attack quadruple bypass march. side effect ive seen voice gets hoarse easily. dr says isnt metoprolol, research (googling), seems side-effect. dont think lisinopril, lipitor, plavix.
full_review: Ive been taking 50MG daily (25MG twice daily) since my heart attack and quadruple bypass in March 2018.  The only side effect that Ive seen is that my voice gets hoarse very easily.  My Dr says it isnt the Metoprolol, but from my research (googling), it seems that it can be a side-effect.  and I dont think its the lisinopril, lipitor, nor plavix.

review: put metoprolol svt & ist medications made worse, dropped blood pressure low etc. although never completely disappated issues, going everyday occurances every episode. problems getting heart rate exercise (still quite opposite actually! reach) unfortunately didnt stop progression af svt & metoprolol diagnosed af. dosage increased per day. starting work little better preventing rapid af however still get slow af. dry mouth, cold extremities & occasional dizzy spells common however definitely small price pay fem
full_review:
I was put on metoprolol for SVT & IST after other medications made me worse, dropped my blood pressure too low etc. Although it never completely disappated the issues, I was going from everyday occurances to every 3-6months between each episode. No problems getting the heart rate up in exercise (still quite the opposite actually! I can reach 180bpm after 5mins) 
Unfortunately it didnt stop the progression to AF. After 6yrs of SVT & metoprolol I was further diagnosed with AF. Dosage was increased from 25mg to 50-75mg per day. Starting to work a little better now in preventing rapid AF however I still get slow AF. 
Dry mouth, cold extremities & occasional dizzy spells have been all too common however definitely a small price to pay.

28yo fem

review: yrs. keeps blood pressure mitral valve prolapse control. take every hours. cant go hour past time body knows. guess say good thing. but, symptoms check. refuse use alternative medication. downside using beta blockers side effect. break eczema psoriasis, biggest problem medication, medications keeps control well.
full_review: Been on it for 5 yrs. Keeps my blood pressure and mitral valve prolapse under control. Have to take it every 12 hours. Cant go an hour past time or my body knows. I guess you can say that is a not so good thing. But, my symptoms are in check. Refuse to use an alternative medication. The downside to using beta blockers is the side effect. I break out with eczema and psoriasis, these are the biggest problem with this medication, but there are medications that keeps that under control as well.

review: hard know works,ive two years following surgery,aortic valve replacement,vsd repair,maze procedure..two month ago afib episode. heart feel off,this medicine helps control symptoms overall combination losartan warfarin, feel,tired,depressed,im sun sensitive,get unexplained rashes,have low sex drive,diarrea...considering didnt help relapsing al want stop using it.
full_review: Hard to know if it works,ive been on it for two years following surgery,aortic valve replacement,vsd repair,maze procedure..Two month ago I had an Afib episode. When my heart feel off,this medicine helps control the symptoms but overall with the combination of losartan and warfarin, I feel,tired,depressed,Im sun sensitive,get unexplained rashes,have a low sex drive,diarrea...considering it didnt help relapsing al I want to do is stop using it.

condition: Metoprolol Succinate ER (metoprolol) for Supraventricular Tachycardia
review: pots (postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome) tried switch atenolol metoprolol mg x day. zero effect far. raised diastolic bp completely bedridden due hr seems getting higher hour.
full_review: I have POTS (postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome)  and tried to switch from atenolol  to metoprolol 12.5 mg x 2 day. Zero effect so far. Raised diastolic BP and completely bedridden due to HR that seems getting higher by hour.

review: took metoprolol zydus (indian manufacturer days nauseated day. could barely eat, started dry heaving . prescribed ive shortness breath heart palpitations lately. spent days local hospital tests determined cardiac arrythmia issue left upper heart chamber. med absolutely nothing curtail symptoms, nausea day miserable. stopping med. also concerned quality control pharmaceuticals. worth risks side effects.
full_review: Only took METOPROLOL by Zydus (Indian manufacturer) for 4 days and was so nauseated all day.  I could barely eat, and started dry heaving . It was prescribed because Ive been having shortness of breath and heart palpitations lately. Spent 2 days in a local hospital and tests determined I have a cardiac arrythmia issue in my left upper heart chamber. This med did absolutely nothing to curtail my symptoms, and the nausea all day had me miserable. I am stopping the med. I am also concerned about quality control of pharmaceuticals. Just not worth the risks and side effects.

review: metoprolol helped blood pressure really spiked triglycerides. watching cholesterol everything looking good. started med months ago another cholesterol test done. triglycerides went always.
full_review: Metoprolol helped my blood pressure but it really spiked my Triglycerides.  I have been watching my cholesterol for a while now and everything was looking good.  I started on this med a few months ago and had another cholesterol test done.  Triglycerides went up to 238 from always being under 140.

review: ive metoprolol weeks af episode hrs days total knee replacement. opioids pain never developed constipation. came opioids find diarrhoea seems medication. also developed vertigo days ago. reduced severity, still hanging around. seems likely medication. things meant help sleep, metoprolol made difficult sleepless nights, something ive ever before. time controlling heart rate bp, far af. first week home rehab also suffered anxious feeling, unpleasant, crawly feeling chest. seems work though.
full_review: Ive been on Metoprolol for 6 weeks after an AF episode of 15 hrs 2 days after a total knee replacement. I was on opioids for pain and never developed constipation. Came off the opioids and find I have diarrhoea which seems to be the medication. I also developed vertigo 10 days ago. Its reduced in severity, but is still hanging around. Again seems likely to be the medication. Off all things meant to help me sleep, Metoprolol has made for some difficult sleepless nights, not something Ive ever had before. At the same time its controlling my heart rate and BP, and so far no more AF. My first week home from rehab I also suffered the anxious feeling, which was an unpleasant, crawly feeling in my chest. It seems to work though.

review: taken toprol xl years atrial fib tachycardia. get anxious times without blood pressure heart rate race chance could convert af. lately however, heart rate fallen low taking mg doctor taken completely. feel shaky now. hands visibly tremble notice get adrenaline rush pressure fear. need something replace dont want experience af need something calm down. suggestions would appreciated.
full_review: I have taken Toprol XL for years for atrial fib and tachycardia. I get very anxious at times without this and my blood pressure and heart rate will race with the chance it could convert to AF. Lately however, my heart rate has fallen to low 40s taking only 10 mg and my doctor has taken me off it completely. I feel very shaky now. My hands visibly tremble and I notice I get more of an adrenaline rush when under pressure or fear. I need something to replace this because I dont want to experience AF again and I need something to calm me down. Any suggestions would be appreciated.

review: daily migraines aura couple years, mostly likely triggered much stress work combination long hours, lots pressure hostile environment. constantly stress, body flooded stress hormones, strong heart-beating etc. metoprolol helped lot reducing stress level adjusting relaxed attitude work. calms reducing heart beat etc. perspective helpful getting healthier path. also helped reducing migraines, even though stayed. longer run, need take higher dosage achieve similar effect. stage impression drug didnt help much longer, stopped.
full_review: I have been having daily migraines with aura for a couple of years, mostly likely triggered by too much stress at work and combination of long hours, lots of pressure and hostile environment. I was constantly under stress, with my body flooded with stress hormones, strong heart-beating etc. Metoprolol helped me a lot in reducing my stress level and adjusting to a more relaxed attitude at work. It calms you down by reducing your heart beat etc. From this perspective it was helpful for getting on a healthier path. It also helped reducing the migraines, even though they stayed. Over the longer run, you need to take higher dosage to achieve a similar effect. at some stage I had the impression the drug didnt help much any longer, so stopped.

review: prescribed medicine triple by-pass heart surgery april worked fairly good high blood pressure worked wonders aura type migraine problem migraine spells per week surgery none since surgery started taking metoprolol. grateful migraine problem reduced almost none. side-effects drug, tolerate ok. nothing could bad migraines had, side-effects dont bother me.
full_review: I was prescribed this medicine just before my triple by-pass heart surgery in April 2014 and it has worked fairly good for my high blood pressure and has worked wonders for my  aura type migraine problem. I was having up to 5 migraine spells per week before my surgery to none since my surgery when I started taking Metoprolol. I am very grateful the migraine problem has been reduced to almost none. I do have a few side-effects from this drug, but I can tolerate them ok. Nothing could be as bad as those migraines I had, so the side-effects dont bother me.

review: given metoprolol use prn premature atrial contraction (pac) developed bloating, indigestion intermittent constipation. used night small dose mg. weeks woke severe llq pain fever. dx diverticulitis. painful heavy duty antibiotics. sure happened metoprolol never take again. stopped metoprolol never stopped pac’s anyway. started inderal.
full_review:
Was given metoprolol to use prn for premature atrial contraction (PAC) and developed bloating, indigestion and intermittent constipation. Only used it at night small dose 12.5 mg. After a few weeks woke up at 2 am with severe LLQ pain and 101 fever. Was dx with diverticulitis. Very painful and heavy duty antibiotics. Not sure if this happened because of metoprolol but will never take it again. 
Stopped the metoprolol it never stopped the PAC’s anyway. and started on Inderal.

review: metoprolol tartrate godsend me. years palpitations told tests (ekgs, stress, halter monitor) normal, anxiety. sometimes several minute times day. scared increased anxiety. finally dr said slight tachycardia, resting heart rate usually around prescribed metoprolol twice day. first week hated medicine. swore made feel right. believe reading negative reviews. couple weeks, palps gone, rating heart rate around. year later say palps rare. medicine worked wonderful me.
full_review: Metoprolol Tartrate 50mg has been a Godsend to me. After years of having palpitations and being told my tests (ekgs, stress, halter monitor) were normal,  that it was just anxiety.  Sometimes I was having several a minute to only a few times a day.  They scared me which just increased my anxiety. Finally my dr said I had slight tachycardia, my resting heart rate was usually around 100bpm and prescribed me metoprolol 50mg twice a day.  The first week i hated this medicine.  Swore it made me feel just not right. I believe it was from reading negative reviews. After a couple weeks, palps gone,  rating heart rate a around 60bpm. A year later I can say palps are rare.  This medicine worked wonderful for me.

review: excited metoprolol helped much migraines headaches. started taking svt, also helps tremendously. hate trying taking medication sure glad did. course everyone different, tried another beta blocker couldnt handle it.
full_review: I am very excited that metoprolol has helped me so much with migraines and headaches. I started taking it for SVT,  which it also helps tremendously. I hate trying and taking any medication but I sure am glad I did. Of course everyone is different, I tried another beta blocker and couldnt handle it.

review: previously posted year ago subject. nine months taking, cardiologist dropped, per day metoprolol succinate. id like med-free, dont know possible point. im walkingjogging miles per week, better shape ive ever been. feel great time, still get extremely tired. dont know thats drug, natural aging. :)
full_review: I previously posted over a year ago on this subject. After nine months of taking 50mgday, my cardiologist dropped me down to 25mg, once per day of Metoprolol Succinate. Id like to be med-free, but I dont know if it is possible at this point. Im walkingjogging 15-18 miles per week, and in better shape now than Ive ever been. I feel great most of the time, but still get extremely tired. I dont know if thats the drug, or just natural aging. :)

review: works well rapid heart beat caused dumping syndrome began major surgery stomach duodenam. name surgery pyloroplasty, vagotomy (severing vagus nerve) hiatel hernia repair back, followed removal gallbladder appendix two years later exacerbated effects rapid heart beat. metoprolol along ativan sublingual, keeps dumping syndrome check time, eat something doesnt agree anatomy, (creamy sauces, alchohol, milk, etc.)
full_review:
Works well with rapid heart beat caused by Dumping Syndrome which began
after having very major surgery on my Stomach and Duodenam.
The name of the surgery was Pyloroplasty, Vagotomy (severing the vagus nerve) and Hiatel
Hernia repair back in 1985, followed by removal of my Gallbladder and appendix two
years later which exacerbated the effects of rapid heart beat. Metoprolol along with Ativan
sublingual, keeps the Dumping Syndrome in check most of the time, until I eat something
that doesnt agree with my anatomy, (Creamy sauces, alchohol, milk, etc.)

I have had so many side effects eg; insomnia  migraines  sexual dyfunction  sweating and possibly more. It did however stop my heart going crazy, but cant deal with side effects doctor advised I can go off them.

Although it has controlled my blood pressure, the side effects (fatigue, confusion, fogginess) have become bad over the last 14 months.  Im trying to convince my doctor to switch me to something else.

review: prescribed metoprolol mvp years really helped palpitations perfect me. recently developed high blood pressure cardiologist took metoprolol, tried various bp medications, side effects (double vision, bloating, diarrhea, headaches, name it. wants beta blocker beta blockers causes kinds side effects. put back metoprolol day, since higher dosage, ive gained weight cant lose it, another side effect drug. wrists face swollen. go see july almost certain dosage blood pressure . going suggest put back mg use something else work metoprolol help lower blood pressure. drug work mvp, lower dosage.
full_review: I was prescribed metoprolol for my MVP. I have been on it for about 2 years and Its really helped with the palpitations. I was on 25mg and was perfect for me.  I recently developed high blood pressure and my cardiologist took me off of the metoprolol, and we tried various BP medications, I had side effects (double vision, bloating, diarrhea, headaches, you name it.  She wants me on a beta blocker and beta blockers causes all kinds of side effects. She put me back on metoprolol but now I am on 50mg a day,  Since I have been on the higher dosage, Ive gained weight and cant lose it, Again another side effect of this drug.   My wrists and face are swollen. I go again to see her in July and I am almost certain she will up the dosage because the blood pressure is not what it should be .  I am going to suggest that she put me back on my 25 mg and use something else that will work with the metoprolol to help lower my blood pressure.  This is the only drug that can work for my MVP, but at a lower dosage.

review: two stents put heart attack. three months later started getting dizzy times would go knee mg metoprolol. put mg metoprolol thing going on. put mg one time heavy breathing went away minutes weeks nothing else. time tell. noticed triggers outside caffeine.
full_review: I had two stents put in after heart attack. About three months later I started getting dizzy and at times would go down to my knee. I was on 5 mg metoprolol. Then I was put on 25 mg metoprolol and had the same thing going on. So I was put on 50 mg and had one time heavy breathing but that was all went away after 20 minutes. Have been on 50 for 3 weeks nothing else. Time will tell. I noticed no triggers outside of caffeine.

condition: Metoprolol Succinate ER (metoprolol) for High Blood Pressure
review: got blood pressure control metoprolol , take propranolol divided times day. must say helped allot. social anxiety almost gone away. sure takes weeksmonths get it, beginning felt depressed, tired, erectile dysfunction (which easily treatable citrullinearginine viagra) got low blood sugar. almost year mild side effects treatable (tiredness) tried before: diuretics, ace inhibitors, calcium channel blockers arbs beta blockers best since medications far worse side effects. something add might pots (self diagnosed) maybe it’s works well me. pulse gets bpm without these.
full_review:
It got my blood pressure under control with 25mg metoprolol , I take it with 40mg propranolol divided 2 times a day. Must say it helped allot. 
Had social anxiety which has been almost gone away. 

Sure it takes a few weeksmonths to get into it, at the beginning I felt depressed, tired, erectile dysfunction (which is easily treatable with citrullineArginine or viagra) and got low blood sugar. Now after almost a year I have mild side effects but are treatable (tiredness) 

Have tried before: diuretics, ace inhibitors, calcium channel blockers and ARBs and for me beta blockers are the best since the other medications had far worse side effects.

Something I have to add is I might have POTS (self diagnosed) and maybe it’s why it works so well for me. My pulse gets from 60 to under 100 bpm without these.

condition: Metoprolol Tartrate (metoprolol) for High Blood Pressure
review: medication take. high blood pressure. since taking swollen feet, dizziness, weakness. really dont like feel. talking doctor see stop medication.
full_review: This is the only medication I take.  It is for high blood pressure.  Since taking it I have swollen feet, dizziness, weakness.  I really dont like how I feel.  I will be talking to my doctor to see if I can stop this medication.

review: i’ve propafanone years went afib haven’t attacks since. sudden propafanone started giving dizziness, got pvcs hours end, like felt every beat. cardiologist prescribed metoprolol mg. took ruined me, bp dropped, heart rate dropped er hb around bpressure. good. finally discontinued propafanone obviously metoprolol. gonna wear heart monitor couple days, discussing ablation surgery. can’t take meds.
full_review: I’ve been on Propafanone for about 5 years after went into Afib and haven’t had any other attacks since. All of a sudden Propafanone started giving me dizziness, got PVCs for hours on end, like felt them every other beat. Cardiologist prescribed Metoprolol 25 mg. Took it and it ruined me, BP dropped, heart rate dropped was in the ER with Hb of around 45-50 bpressure 8040. Not good. Finally discontinued Propafanone and obviously Metoprolol. Gonna wear a heart monitor for couple of days, discussing ablation surgery. Can’t take the meds.

full_review: I have had low blood pressure (I normally have high blood pressure) and my mind feels fuzzy and cant concentrate while taking it.  I also have insomnia. I have only been on it 11 days.  I hope most of these side effects lessen over time.

review: dose twice daily week. far drug helped. blood pressure low mid upon arising. mid mid noon. take first dose dose. plan contact doctor monday.
full_review: Have only been on a 50mg dose twice daily for a week. So far the drug has not helped. My blood pressure is in 120sto low 130sover mid 80s upon arising. In mid 150s over mid 90s by noon, and 170s over 100s by 6:00pm. I take the first dose about 8:00am and 2nd dose about 5:00pm. Plan to contact my doctor on monday.

review: metoprolol worked well guess problem adrenaline causing svt would happen sleep deprived panic attacks usually verapamil didn’t help much think drug cured issue side effects noticed feeling lazy live it. reference bad svt attacks get panic attacks almost everyday taking weeks gonna happen times would happened before. recommend treatment also negatives says supposed take benadryl medicine cause may lower blood pressure rely sleep every solution breeds new problem
full_review: metoprolol worked well for me I guess my problem was adrenaline causing my SVT it would happen when I was sleep deprived and having a panic attacks usually verapamil didn’t help as much but I think this drug cured the issue for me only side effects I have noticed is feeling more lazy but you can live with it. For reference I have had 4 bad SVT attacks and I get panic attacks almost everyday but been taking it for a few weeks and if it was gonna happen there is a few times it would have happened before. I recommend this treatment also other negatives says your not supposed to take Benadryl while on this medicine cause it may lower your blood pressure and I rely on that to sleep but every solution breeds a new problem

review: took days. blood pressure started drop, woke morning taking dose red spots arms looked like beginning bruise. arms felt tired day. held big bag apples hand orchard minutes way home noticed bruises appearing arms. thing happened evening shopping - holding stack clothes arm red spots streaks started appearing arm holding clothes over. quit taking contact doctor.
full_review: I only took this for 3 days.  My blood pressure had started to drop, but I woke up the morning after taking the 3rd dose with red spots on my arms that looked like the beginning of a bruise.  My arms felt tired all day.  I held a big bag of apples in each hand at the orchard for about 10 minutes and on the way home noticed more bruises appearing on both arms.  The same thing happened that evening while shopping - I was holding a stack of clothes over my arm and red spots and streaks started appearing on the arm I was holding the clothes over.  I have quit taking them until I can contact my doctor.

review: husband congestive heart failure. admitted hospital fluid hear & lungs weeks ago. never experienced afib before. atenolol years bp controlled. hospital monitor started showing afib stopped atenolol started metoprelol. weak several years due chf. combative, sleeping, talking sleep. remembers none it. part drug side affect? due fact chf much worse facing hard reality? suggestions ideas helpful. calling cardiologist tomorrow
full_review:
My husband has congestive heart failure.
Was admitted to hospital with fluid on hear & lungs 2 weeks ago.  He had never experienced AFIB before.  He has been on Atenolol for 13 years with bp controlled.  While in hospital his monitor started showing AFIB so they stopped atenolol and started Metoprelol.  He has been weak for several years due to CHF.  Now his is combative, not sleeping, talking in his sleep.  But he remembers none of it.  Is this part of the drug side affect?  Or due to the fact the CHF is much worse and he is facing hard reality?  Any suggestions or ideas will be helpful.  Calling cardiologist tomorrow

review: years misery come across gift god! give shot! fyi- generics way better others one doesnt work dont give hope. plus prescribed three months time save costs! good luck! keep heart rate down! ;)
full_review: 20 years of misery and then I come across this gift from God! Give it a shot! FYI- some generics are WAY better than others so if one doesnt work dont give up hope. Plus you can have it prescribed three months at a time to save on costs! Good Luck! Keep that heart rate down! ;)

review: used connection marfans syndrome. dose. heart rate lowered intended, help anxiety symptoms, nice bonus. however became tired time, lost interest studies, also caused slurred speech weeks usage dose working effectively terms keeping heart rate down. see reason keep going, raising dose would probably destroyed life. doctor agreed side effects would cause long term damage, im put different beta blocker now. medicine cheap, benefits beginning really nice, wish body didnt react negatively metoprolol.
full_review:
Used it in connection with Marfans Syndrome. My dose was 50mg. My heart rate lowered as intended, and it did help with some anxiety symptoms, which was a nice bonus. However I became tired all the time, I lost interest in my studies, and it also caused slurred speech.
After 2 weeks of usage, the 50mg dose was not working as effectively in terms of keeping my heart rate down. I did not see any reason to keep going, as raising the dose to 100mg would have probably destroyed my life. My doctor agreed that the side effects would cause long term damage, and Im being put on a different beta blocker now.
The medicine is cheap, and the benefits it had in the beginning was really nice, so I wish that my body didnt react so negatively to metoprolol.

review: started psvt. also verapamil, propranolol atenolol time. felt like walking dead time got till went bed. rf ablation done. fine several years, medicines, problems. psvt back full force put digoxin increased several times due lack control. stress test done minute stopped doctor put hospital taken digoxin started mg metoprolol. fair control psvt minor problems control maybe month unless stressed psvt trouble couple times day. main side effect energy level real low.
full_review: I started having PSVT when I was 23, now 42. I was also on verapamil, propranolol and atenolol at the same time. I felt like the walking dead from time I got up till I went to bed. So had RF ablation done. Was fine for several years, no medicines, no problems. Then PSVT was back full force was put on digoxin that was increased several times due to lack of control. Had stress test done and after just over 1 minute was stopped by Doctor put in hospital taken off digoxin and started on 50 mg of metoprolol. I now have fair control of PSVT with just minor problems that I can control maybe once a month unless stressed and PSVT can be trouble couple times a day. Main side effect is energy level REAL low.

review: prescribed metoprolol tachycardia regular beta blocker unavailable. normal side effects, strange one - medication made extremely allergic shellfish. allergic discontinuing couple weeks ago.
full_review: I was prescribed Metoprolol for tachycardia because my regular beta blocker was unavailable. Other than the normal side effects, I had a very strange one - this medication made me extremely allergic to shellfish. I was not allergic before nor am I now after discontinuing it a couple weeks ago.

review: svt high blood pressure years dr. switched metoprolol atenolol. medication works great one caveat - must check brand youre getting. dr. changed dosage, resulted different dosage pills. suddenly blood pressure jumped heart beating erratically, chest pains (which ive never had), constantly worn out. checked brands former medications new found different. switched back old meds new dosage couple days within day blood pressure dropped points felt back normal. pharmacy special orders mylan brand, aurobindo doesnt work all.
full_review: I have SVT and high blood pressure. After 10 years the dr. switched me to Metoprolol from Atenolol. The medication works great with one caveat - you MUST check which brand youre getting.  The dr. changed my dosage, which resulted in different dosage pills. Suddenly my blood pressure jumped and my heart was beating erratically, chest pains (which Ive never had), and I was constantly worn out. I checked the brands of the former medications and the new and found they were different. I switched back to the old meds at the new dosage for a couple of days and within 1 day my blood pressure dropped 20 points and I felt back to normal. Now the pharmacy special orders the Mylan brand, as the Aurobindo doesnt work at all.

review: metoprolol life saver me. since stopped making timolol pill form, trying three beta blockers, one best. beginning doubt anything would completely control tachycardia high blood pressure both. real side effects first month so, lethargy, worth long term good metoprolol done me.
full_review: Metoprolol has been a life saver for me.  Since they stopped making Timolol in pill form, and trying three other beta blockers, this one is the best.  I was beginning to doubt anything would completely control my tachycardia and high blood pressure but this does both.  No real side effects after the first month or so, which was lethargy, but that was worth it for the long term good Metoprolol has done for me.

review: far worst medication i’ve ever week tapered off. extreme dizziness, felt like complete rubbish week decided get it. went doctor one day said heart pounding put metoprolol mg twice day). week poisoning decided get it. anxiety always waking panic attack crazy. withdrawals ugly also though i’d rather tough go back stuff. don’t feel like anymore i’m hoping subsides small dose short period time. everyone careful poison.
full_review: This is by far the worst medication I’ve ever been on and I was only on it for a week and then tapered off. Extreme dizziness, and felt like complete rubbish during that week so decided to get off it. Went to the doctor one day and said my heart was pounding but it was only at 86 and put me on Metoprolol (12.5 mg twice a day). After a week of poisoning myself I decided to get off it. The anxiety and always waking up in a panic attack was crazy. The withdrawals are ugly also though but I’d rather tough it out then go back on this stuff. I don’t feel like myself at all anymore but I’m hoping it subsides as I was only on a small dose for a short period of time. Everyone should be careful with this poison.

review: use high blood pressure tremors caused mood stabilizers. miss dose even hours notice tremors become quite quickly worse metoprolol. works well, perfectly. definitely would completely miserable quite debilitated without it.
full_review: I use this both for high blood pressure and for tremors caused by my mood stabilizers. If I miss my dose by even a few hours I notice the tremors become quite quickly worse than while on metoprolol. Works well, but not perfectly. Definitely would be completely miserable and quite debilitated without it.

review: migraines thunderclaps last weeks, everyday except one raging mildly annoying viscous thunder claps. pain relief minimal effect, havent work days tired function. dr gave metoprolol days, still getting migraines also new side effect. feel like im merry go round sit stand. balance wanna stop drug. early tell working?
full_review:
Migraines and thunderclaps for last 3 weeks, everyday except one and raging from mildly annoying to viscous thunder claps. Pain relief has had minimal effect, I havent been to work and most days too tired to function.
Dr gave metoprolol, been on it 2 days, I am still getting migraines and also a new side effect. I feel like Im on a merry go round when I sit up or stand. My balance is so off I wanna stop the drug. Is it too early to tell if its working?

review: metoprolol yrs. diagnosed high blood pressure yrs old, started im. experience anxiety lot tiredness, along dizziness times. medicine work,just hoping day kidneys mend stop taking medicine.
full_review: I have been on Metoprolol for 20 yrs. I was diagnosed with High Blood pressure when I was 23 yrs old, started on 100mg now Im on 25mg. I do experience anxiety a lot and tiredness, along with dizziness at times. The medicine does work,just hoping some day my kidneys will mend themselves so I can STOP taking this medicine.

review: im giving med far havent real side effects it, like another bp med (cant remember name). however still bouts high readings, see pcp week, might raise. say prefer see cardiologist terrified exercising. yes, know exercise weight loss lower bp healthy levels, cant understand exert high bp. shouldnt first controlled meds first exercising?
full_review: Im giving this med a 7 so far just because I havent had any real side effects with it, like I did with another bp med (cant remember the name). However, @ 25mg I still have bouts of high readings, so when I see my PCP this week, she might raise it to 50mg. I will say that I prefer to see a Cardiologist for this because I am terrified of exercising. Yes, I know exercise and weight loss can lower my bp to healthy levels, but I cant understand I can exert myself while having high bp. Shouldnt it first be controlled with meds first before exercising?

review: miracle drug. take pill evening. gone constant heart pounding sit lie down. suffered years. whole pill made blood pressure low, half perfect.
full_review: This is a miracle drug.  I take 12 of a 25mg pill in evening.  Gone are the constant heart pounding when I sit and lie down.  I suffered from it for 2 years.  A whole pill made my blood pressure too low, but half is perfect.

review: terrible symptoms mvp landed hospital days. started taking medicine mg day symptoms much better. used shortness breath, palpitations, chest pain, weakness much better now. occasionally palpitations nothing like before. metoprolol works great!
full_review: I had terrible symptoms of MVP that landed me in the hospital for 5 days. I started taking this medicine 25 mg a day and my symptoms are so much better. I used to have shortness of breath, palpitations, chest pain, and weakness but its so much better now. I only occasionally have some palpitations but nothing like before. Metoprolol works great!

review: put mg x day rapid, arrhythmic heartbeat high blood pressure, november last year. first, made sleepy dizzy, gotten that. lowered heart rate low, occasionally upper. halving dose changed this; hoping it, least even lower dose, next cardiology appointment june. think making forgetful. definitely problem since taking it, although bit absent-minded professor before. may also helped lower blood pressure, although made diet lifestyle changes would affect that, also.
full_review: I was put on 50 mg 3 X a day for rapid, arrhythmic heartbeat and high blood pressure, in November last year.  At first, it made me very sleepy and dizzy, but I have gotten over that. It lowered my heart rate into the low 60s and 50s, occasionally upper 40s. Halving the dose has not changed this; I am hoping to be off it, or at least on an even lower dose, after my next cardiology appointment in June.  I think it is making me forgetful. That has definitely been a problem since taking it, although I was a bit of an absent-minded professor before. It may also have helped lower my blood pressure, although I have made some diet and lifestyle changes that would affect that, also.

review: taking metoprolol times per day since beginning january heart rate still high bpm average seventy one year old male previously active good health. climb stairs short breath feel weaker normal. previous taking digoxin x. controlledcapped hr without side effects. hr increased comparison since starting metoprolol. would welcome comment.
full_review: I am taking Metoprolol 50mg 3 times per day since the beginning of January and my heart rate is still very high137 bpm on average for a seventy one year old male previously active and in good health.  When I climb stairs I am short of breath feel weaker than normal. Previous taking Digoxin 62.5mg x3day. This controlledcapped my HR at 115bpm without side effects. So my HR has increased by comparison since starting Metoprolol. I would welcome all your comment.

review: metoprolol mg twice day nothing afib, however cardiologist put metoprolol succinate er mg day straightened afib extended release pill slowly releases medicine throughout day night. took ablation done worked years came back stronger extended release version metoprolol given me. longer see cardiologist every months every months.my cardiologist happy metoprolol succinate er mg me. works well.
full_review: Metoprolol 25 mg twice a day did nothing for my AFib, however when my cardiologist put me on Metoprolol succinate ER 25 mg once a day it straightened my AFib up because its an extended release pill that slowly releases the medicine throughout the day and night. Before I took it I had to have ablation done which worked for 5 years then it came back stronger until the extended release version of Metoprolol was given to me. I no longer see my cardiologist every 3 months but every 6 months.My cardiologist and I are both happy with Metoprolol succinate ER 25 mg for me. It works well.

review: maximal given dose day) answer, since bringing propafenon starting propafenon dose metoprolol reduced mg day. success, one problem , taking metoprolol cant stop eating :d stopping metoprolol (switched bisoprolol) lost kg male
full_review:
maximal given dose to me was 200mg  day (4x50mg) No answer, since bringing in Propafenon 
after starting propafenon  my dose metoprolol is reduced to 100 mg  day. which has been a success,
one problem , when taking metoprolol I cant stop eating :D after stopping metoprolol (switched to bisoprolol) have lost 13 kg

review: take metoprolol tartrate metoprolol hydrochlorthiazide, however noticed marked frequency urination polyuria starting medication. doctor suspected urinary tract infection (although experiencing dysuria, fever, chills typical uti symptoms). urinalysis negative, prostate exam negative, cystoscopy negative. medicine supposed doing, urinate every two hours around clock certainly interfering sleep. find reference drugs.com said increased urination rarely encountered side effect drug, doctors insist doesnt side effect spent fortune ruling conditions.
full_review:
I take metoprolol tartrate not metoprolol with hydrochlorthiazide, however I have noticed a marked frequency of urination and polyuria after starting this medication.  My doctor suspected a urinary tract infection (although I am not experiencing dysuria, fever, chills or having any other typical UTI symptoms).  Urinalysis was negative, prostate exam was negative, cystoscopy was negative.

The medicine is doing what it is supposed to be doing, but having to urinate every two hours around the clock is certainly interfering with my sleep.  I did find a reference on Drugs.com that said increased urination was a rarely encountered side effect of this drug, but my doctors insist it doesnt have that side effect and I have spent a fortune ruling out other conditions.

review: ascending aortic aneurysm put metoprolol help control chest pain lower heart rate. ive month half much pain heart rate dropped. side effected noted mild dizziness every while. id like pain, considering situation thats realistic id say im happy results far.
full_review: I have an ascending aortic aneurysm and was put on metoprolol to help control chest pain and lower my heart rate. Ive been on it 1 month and have about half a much pain and my heart rate has dropped from 100s down to 80s. Only side effected noted is mild dizziness every once in a while. Id like to have no pain, but considering my situation thats not realistic so Id say Im happy with the results so far.

review: sure betaloc causes get tummy , take warfarin aorta valve done years ago ( ats) . healthy diet , couple glasses red wine night , overweight tummy never prior taking sorts beta blockers . betaloc years failed maze treatment afib
full_review:
I am sure that Betaloc causes me to get a tummy , I take warfarin as I had an Aorta valve done 12 years ago ( ATS) .
Have a very healthy diet , couple of glasses of red wine at night , I am not overweight but I have a tummy that I never had prior to taking all sorts of Beta blockers  . I have been on Betaloc now for 9 years after a failed Maze treatment for AFib

review: diagnosed paroxysmal atrial tachycardia years old. went er, converted via valsalva maneuver -- went md next dayhad echocardiogram done diagnosed mitral valve prolapse. heart throughout day kept going pat+ bpm) chest pain anything, pounding heartfainting. started lopressor time bid amazing drug. sure still get odd pat episode while, pounding skipped beats greatly reduced. side effects all. actually calming effect. lopressor years. great antiarrhythmic.
full_review: I was diagnosed with Paroxysmal Atrial Tachycardia  in 1980 when I was 19 years old. Went to the ER, converted myself via Valsalva Maneuver -- went to my MD the next dayhad an echocardiogram done and was diagnosed with Mitral Valve Prolapse. My heart throughout the day kept going into PAT (200+ BPM) No chest pain or anything, but pounding heartfainting.  I was started on Lopressor at that time .... 100mg BID and this is an amazing drug. Sure I still get the odd PAT episode once in a while, but the pounding and skipped beats are greatly reduced. No side effects at all. It actually has a calming effect. Been on Lopressor for 35 years. Great antiarrhythmic.

review: happy betaloc cr put atf metoprolol cr crap take morning lasts hours end afib night . never ever trouble betaloc cr
full_review: I was very happy with Betaloc CR 190  and then they put me on ATF Metoprolol CR 190 and it is crap because if I take 1 in the morning it only lasts about 10 to 13 hours and I end up with AFib at night . I never ever had this trouble with Betaloc CR190

review: cindy others- experiencing lot side effects, particularly flushing, may want look mcas (mast cell activation) immediately- get new doctor, mean doesn’t believe you?! additionally: struggled episodic tachycardia hbp odd symptoms past, may want look pots well.
full_review:
CINDY and a few others- if you are experiencing a lot of side effects, PARTICULARLY FLUSHING, you may want to look up MCAS (Mast Cell Activation) immediately- and get a new doctor, what do you mean he doesn’t believe you?! 

Additionally: If you struggled with episodic tachycardia HBP or odd symptoms in the past, you may want to look up POTS as well.

review: started metoprolol tartrate inappropriate sinus tachycardia long qt syndrome. first day. nothing. increased twice day. still nothing. increased twice day brought heart rate lot still lot symptoms. usual resting without medication exercise gets high bpm. get palpitations, sob, fainting etc. recent cardiac monitoring indicated needing increase dose increased mg twice day. resting rate average bpm dont want increase metoprolol anymore theyre adding ivabradine metoprolol. good med lowered heart rate lowered symptoms enough comfortable.
full_review: I was started on Metoprolol Tartrate for Inappropriate Sinus Tachycardia and Long QT syndrome. At first I was on 25 once a day. That did nothing. Increased to 25mg twice a day. Still did nothing. Was increased to 100MG twice a day and it brought my heart rate down but not a lot and was still having a lot of symptoms. My usual resting without the medication is 130bpm and when I exercise it gets as high as 220 bpm. I get palpitations, SOB, fainting and etc. My most recent cardiac monitoring indicated needing to increase my dose so I was increased to 150 MG twice a day. My resting rate is on average 86 bpm now and they dont want to increase the metoprolol anymore so theyre adding Ivabradine to the metoprolol. Its a good med and it has lowered my heart rate and lowered symptoms just not enough for me to be comfortable.

review: blood pressure medicine almost two months. seem well another thing noticed psoriasis cleared up. dont know metoprolol anything it. so, keep it. suffered psoriasis five years straight.
full_review: I have been on this blood pressure medicine now for almost two months. I seem to be doing well and another thing that I noticed my psoriasis has cleared up. I dont know if the metoprolol has anything to do with it. If so, then keep me on it.  I have suffered with psoriasis for five years straight.

review: ive taking metoprolol couple months input see difference started taking it. fact, doctor even increased day two pills morning one night. change. even change pvcs, makes horrible anxiety, least me.
full_review: Ive been taking Metoprolol for a couple months now and input see and difference than before I started taking it. In fact, my doctor even increased it from once a day to two pills in the morning and one at night. No change. Not even a change in pvcs, which makes for horrible anxiety, at least for me.

review: hard patient rate medication. excellent cardiologist whose job is. however, know toprol comes tendency toward depression many people, me, pre-existing depression mildly exacerbated. also take amlodipine since may last year, drug also known causeincrease depression. take several anti-hypertensive drugs therefore easy tell causing what. welcome life post-cardiac bypass surgery--a life diminished, trust me, least--life.
full_review: Its hard for a patient to rate a medication. I have an excellent cardiologist whose job that is.  However, I know that Toprol comes with a tendency toward depression for many people, and for me, pre-existing depression has been mildly exacerbated. I also take amlodipine since May of last year, and this is a drug also known to causeincrease depression. I take several other anti-hypertensive drugs therefore it is not easy to tell which is causing what.  Welcome to life post-cardiac bypass surgery--a life diminished, trust me, but at least--LIFE.

review: months, experiencing blurred vision, ed, itchy skin, sleeplessness crazy dreams. fingernails falling off. researched metoprolol cause nail bed toxicity! want stuff soon doc drug claims fantastic drug heart health!!! (i high blood pressure)
full_review: been on about 18 months, 25MG, now experiencing blurred vision, ED, itchy skin, sleeplessness and crazy dreams. NOW my fingernails are falling off. I researched and metoprolol can cause nail bed toxicity! I want off this stuff soon but the Doc is so up on this drug and claims it is a fantastic drug for my heart health!!! (I do not have high blood pressure)

condition: Metoprolol Tartrate (metoprolol) for High Blood Pressure
review: metoprolol tartrate day years controls afib pretty good. last month ive episodes lasted days, ive never episode last long, bumped dosage mg doctors told ok im afib. past gotten heart back rhythm, doesnt seem effect last two episodes. sure whats putting afib, going see doctor week.
full_review: I have been on 50mg of metoprolol tartrate 2x a day for 10 years and it controls my afib pretty good. The last month Ive had 2 episodes each lasted 3 days, which Ive never  had an episode last this long, bumped up dosage to 75 mg which doctors have told me its ok to do if Im in afib. In the past this has gotten my heart back in rhythm, but doesnt seem to have the same effect these last two episodes. Not sure whats putting me in afib, going to see doctor this week.

review: metoprolol mg couple years. beginning covid sudden numbers went. chance except got new batch pills. looked manufacturer zydus. asked pharmacist could request brand generic. said generally get whatever available. past year numbers. even tried brand-toprol xr didn’t see lower numbers. last couple weeks numbers again. sure enough looked generic zydus.
full_review:
I have been on metoprolol 100 mg for a couple of years. At the beginning of COVID all of a sudden my numbers went down to below 14090. No chance except I got a new batch of pills. I looked up the manufacturer and it was zydus. I asked the pharmacist if I could request this brand of generic. She said they generally get whatever is available. So for the past year my numbers have been up above 14090. Even tried the brand-Toprol XR and didn’t see lower numbers.
The last couple of weeks my numbers have been down  again. Sure enough I just looked up what generic I am on and it is zydus.

review: taking drug angina hypertension weeks. appears drug begun kick blood pressure fallen, experienced chest pain last weeks.
full_review: Taking the drug for angina and hypertension for about 3 weeks. It appears that the drug has begun to kick in and my blood pressure has fallen, I have not experienced any chest pain in the last 2 weeks.

review: take twice day issues since found atrial fibrillation. taking coreq resting heartbeat always, medicine cardiologist says fine pacemaker defibrillator.
full_review: I take 100mg twice a day with no issues since I was found with atrial fibrillation.  Before I was taking Coreq and my resting heartbeat was always 43, now with this medicine its 45 to 50 and my cardiologist says all is fine have a pacemaker and defibrillator.

review: might work nearly finished me. within hours first minimum dosage tablet, heart rate, blood pressure. barely conscious. extremely fatigue next day. took minimum dose tablet response within hours. third day took tiny piece, maybe pill results. stress echocardiogram revealed healthy heart, blockages normal ejection fraction. emergency room doctor cardiologist said keep taking increase dose. way hell! zero ten me.
full_review:
Might work for some but it nearly finished me.  Within 4 hours of first minimum dosage tablet, heart rate was below 40bpm, blood pressure was 8040.  Barely conscious.  Extremely fatigue the next day.  Took 12 of minimum dose tablet and same response within 4 hours.  Third day took a tiny piece, maybe 110th of a pill and same results.  Stress echocardiogram revealed healthy heart, no blockages and normal ejection fraction.

Emergency room doctor and cardiologist said to keep taking it and increase dose.  No way in hell!  Zero out of ten for me.

review: oh side effects terrible. racing heart, sick feeling, anxiety, depression, tingling hands feet. dr. said stop put nifedipine instead. wow change blood pressure sometimes. feel like life back.
full_review: Oh my side effects were terrible. Racing heart, sick feeling, anxiety, depression, tingling hands and feet. Dr. said to stop it and put me on nifedipine 60mg instead. Wow what a change blood pressure down sometimes under 12080. Feel like I have my life back.

condition: Metoprolol Succinate ER (metoprolol) for Supraventricular Tachycardia
review: i’ve beta blockers one really took ride. fine slowed day episode palpitations day intense body aches head aches craziest brain fog feel like told dr said take half (of mg) ended blacking hours later please beware really felt like going crazy one day already feel better
full_review: I’ve been on beta blockers before and this one really took me for a ride. Was fine and slowed down a 5 day episode of palpitations but after day 3 I had intense body aches and head aches the craziest brain fog I just did not feel like myself told the dr and they said take half (of a 25 mg) and ended up blacking out 3 hours later please beware because I really felt like I was going crazy and one day off I already feel better

review: first day metroprolol experiencing hallucinations; id taken empty stomach since taking food havent repeats. saw green fairy brief second. also saw cartoon character wall, bright colorful, little guy scythe cutting base large tree. doctor asked wanted switch, said no, take food now. get extremely tired it. take doctor visits feel slow, calm tired slow. ive bit cough say think yes affect lungs. live anxiety calms this, sleep lot wild dreams it. one abducted interesting. making depressed relaxing point able cry properly, dont know.
full_review: My first day on Metroprolol I was experiencing hallucinations; Id taken it on an empty stomach and since taking it with food I havent had any repeats.  I saw a green fairy for a brief second. I also saw a cartoon character on the wall, bright and colorful, a little  guy with a  scythe cutting at the base of a  large tree. My doctor asked me if I wanted to switch, I said no, I take it with food now. I get extremely tired on it. When I take my doctor visits I feel slow, calm but just tired and slow.  Ive had a bit of a cough on it to say I think yes it does affect the lungs. I live with anxiety and  it calms down on this, I sleep a lot and I have some very wild dreams on it. The one about being abducted was very interesting. Is it making me depressed or is it just relaxing to a point that I am able to cry properly, I dont know.

review: put metoprolol heart started race every time would move anything helped didnt keep way tried trick moving wasnt dropping tried times day still problems. made tired. dont know part problem doctors seeing dont know exactly wrong heart this. yesterday went er hospital week doctor gave propranolol times day helping.
full_review: I was put on metoprolol 50mg after my heart started to race every time I would move or do anything. The 50mg helped some but didnt keep it all the way down so then they tried me on 100mg which did the trick while I was moving but then when I wasnt it was dropping between 30-40beats so then they tried just 25mg 4 times a day and I was still having problems. It made me tired. I dont know if part of the problem is the doctors I have been seeing dont know what exactly is wrong with my heart and why it does this. Just yesterday I went to the ER after being in the hospital for a week and the doctor gave me propranolol 10mg 3 times a day which is helping.

review: ablation put end afib flutter, left periodic svt. started taking metoprolol twice daily, relief muscle fatigue shortness breath. ive started, im apprehensive drug tend cause sleepiness lethargy people. interestingly, valsalva maneuvers little effect svt. atrial flutter, carotid message stopped straightaway. thing seems help svt splashing cold water face yoga breathing (inhale, hold, slowly exhale counting). sometimes repeat im literally blue face. quote terminator, ill back.
full_review: I had an ablation that put an end to my AFIB and flutter, but left me with periodic SVT.  Started taking 25mg metoprolol twice daily, but no relief from muscle fatigue and shortness of breath.  Ive just started on 50mg 2X, which Im apprehensive about because the drug does tend to cause sleepiness and lethargy in some people. Interestingly, Valsalva maneuvers have little effect on my SVT.  When I had atrial flutter, carotid message stopped it straightaway.  The only thing that seems to help with SVT is splashing cold water on my face or doing yoga breathing (inhale, hold, and slowly exhale while counting to 10).  Sometimes I have to repeat that until Im literally blue in the face.  To quote the Terminator, Ill be back.

review: started metoprolol months ago mg, twice day (plus hydrochorothiazide mg taking months). treat high systolic pressure originally though diastolic. metoprolol effect weeks systolic dropped. end weeks increased metoprolol mgday end week systolic climed. sure effect having, except experience symptoms dry mouth unpleasant.
full_review: I started on metoprolol 2 months ago at 25 mg, twice a day (plus hydrochorothiazide at 25 mg that I have been taking for 3 months). This is to treat a high systolic pressure that was originally at 145 though my diastolic was at 75. Metoprolol had no effect for 3 weeks until my systolic dropped to 127 from about 137. At the end of that 3 weeks I increased metoprolol to 75 mgday and by the end of the 6th week my systolic had climed to 134. So I am not sure what effect it is having, except that I experience symptoms of a dry mouth which is unpleasant.

review: taking betaloc years main problem fatigue get . perm afib failed maze treatment aorta valve replaced years ago , asked gp could lower dose daily weeks strong bouts afib decided go back . thoughts matter.
full_review: I have been taking 190mg Betaloc for a few years and the main problem is the fatigue that I get . I have perm AFib from a failed Maze treatment while having my Aorta valve replaced 9 years ago , I asked my GP if I could lower the dose to  142.5mg daily . I have been doing this now for about 3 weeks but now I am having strong bouts of AFib so I have decided to go back on to 190mg again . What are your thoughts on this matter.

review: taken metoprolol succinate x daily nearly years svt. havent problems issues. try medications svt awful side effects. took metoprolol tartrate years didnt last long next dose switched back succinate.
full_review:
I have taken Metoprolol Succinate 50mg 2 x daily for nearly 20 years for SVT.  I havent had any problems or issues.  I did try other medications for the SVT but they had awful side effects.
I took the Metoprolol Tartrate for 3 years but it didnt last long until the next dose so I switched back to the Succinate.

review: drug lifesaver me. developed v tachsvt following battle c diff. cardiologist put metoprolol slowly increased dosage. take mg morning dropped mg mg night added clonidine. late taking med, heart rate quickly escalates. med, resting heart rate.
full_review:
This drug has been a lifesaver for me. 
I developed V tachSVT following a battle with C Diff. My Cardiologist put me on Metoprolol and slowly increased the dosage. I now take 100 mg morning and just dropped from 100 mg to 50 mg night as he added Clonidine. 
If I am late taking my med, my heart rate quickly escalates. On the med, my resting heart rate is in the 60s.

review: put high blood pressure anxiety. works sometimes side effects awful. gained lbs months. even worse headaches light headedness, headaches sometimes last days. aspirin doesnt work. take hot showers couple x day ease tension head. im almost im new diet.
full_review: I was put on this for high blood pressure and anxiety.  It works sometimes but the side effects are awful.  Gained 30 lbs in 3 months.  But even worse are the headaches and light headedness, the headaches sometimes last for days. And aspirin doesnt work. I take hot showers a couple x a day to ease the tension in my head. Im almost off of it as Im on a new diet.

review: medicine mg seven years works great. problem pharmacy changes suppliers time. good thing get pills worry every months. always ask supplier.
full_review: I have been on this medicine 25 mg for seven years now works great. The only problem is my pharmacy changes suppliers all the time. The good thing is I get 90 pills so only have to worry every 3 months. I always ask for the same supplier.

review: diagnosed heart failure prescribed metoprolol years ago! also briefly coreg (carvedilol), effective heart medication, opinion, couldnt take side effects, including racing heart nervousness. lets face it, medications cause side effects, serious others, asked cardiologist allow take heart meds night, made huge difference anxious, dizzy, lightheaded day.
full_review: I was diagnosed with heart failure and was prescribed metoprolol more than 16 years ago! I also was briefly on Coreg (carvedilol), a more effective heart medication, in my opinion, but I couldnt take the side effects, including the racing heart and the nervousness.  Lets face it, most medications cause side effects, some more serious than others, because of this asked my cardiologist to allow me to take all of my heart meds at night, which made a huge difference in my being anxious, dizzy, and lightheaded during day.

review: pff, dont even know start. took mg metoprolol im addition mg losartan back february. im taking losartan since, never problem. start metoprolol month later ive noted pulse going occasionally. didnt give much think july start nearly lose conscience weeks nightmare, blood pressure low pulse. ive taking ambulance. point doctor told stop taking ,which did. pulse back normal now.i panic attacks instead weeks without metoprolol im getting worse. check everything couldve possibly check, everything looks normal. one thing know, metoprolol ruined last months. im even scared take regular medication since. horrible experience drug

After I start Metoprolol, 2 month later Ive noted that my pulse is going down occasionally. Didnt give me much to think up until July when I start to nearly lose my conscience. 3 weeks of nightmare, my blood pressure was very low but my pulse was 50. Once Ive been taking by the ambulance. review: taking mg day, morning) chest troubles, pain, angina, high blood pressure, .. also taking adalat sustained release tablets (nifedipine mg hours. adalat isnt enough pain. now, feel ok, acceptable side effects products. still dont know whether try preductal sustained release tablets mg instead metoprolol sustained release tablets mg. ive heard, excellent treating said above.
full_review:
Taking it (50 mg once a day, in the morning) for chest troubles, pain, angina, high blood pressure, ..
Also taking Adalat Sustained Release Tablets (Nifedipine) 20 mg, each 12 hours.
Adalat isnt enough for my pain. Now, I feel OK, acceptable side effects from both of the products. I still dont know whether I should try PREDUCTAL Sustained Release Tablets 35 mg instead of Metoprolol Sustained Release Tablets 50 mg. From what Ive heard, both are excellent in treating what I said above.

condition: Metoprolol Succinate ER (metoprolol) for High Blood Pressure
review: prescribed hours-long afib episode went er. meds prior this. cardiologist ended prescribing mg day) paradaxa. meto kept blood pressure afib episodes relatively rare short lasting. so, complaints far. feel much better did, although get tired late afternoon. but, might due always trouble sleeping.
full_review:
I was prescribed this when I had an hours-long AFib episode and went to ER. No meds prior to this.
Cardiologist ended up prescribing this (25 mg once a day) with Paradaxa. 
The meto has kept my blood pressure down and AFib episodes are relatively rare now and only short lasting. So, no complaints so far. Feel much better than I did, although I get tired in late afternoon. But, this might be due to always having trouble sleeping.

review: hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy take metoprolol twice day keep heart rate lowered blood pressure down. job well, side affects rough handle sometimes. dizziness, sleepless nights, daytime drowsiness, forgetfulness, depression but, im still coping four years guess rest life. manage three brother suicides you.
full_review: I have hypertrophic obstructive cardiomyopathy and take metoprolol twice a day to keep my heart rate lowered and blood pressure down. It does the job well, but the side affects are rough to handle sometimes. Such as dizziness, sleepless nights, daytime drowsiness, forgetfulness, and depression but, im still coping after about four years and i guess on for the rest of my life. But if i can manage after three brother suicides than so can you.

review: like taking metoprolol years now. experiencing many symptoms described. disturbing sexual side effects experienced. erections shorter feels though lost ability. besides uneasy sleep, muscle weakness unexplained twitching. thankful finding site stopping medication today. prescribed daily heart failure.
full_review: Like most of you all I have been taking metoprolol for about 4 years now. I have been experiencing many of the symptoms that most have described. The most disturbing is the sexual side effects that I have experienced. My erections are shorter and It feels as though I have lost that ability. Besides the uneasy sleep, muscle weakness and unexplained twitching. I am thankful for finding this site because I am stopping this medication today. I have been prescribed 100mg daily after my heart failure.

review: diagnosis hypertrophic cardiomyopathy drug relaxed heart muscle allowing pump blood better also eliminated lowered extra heart beats experienced. may also assist treating managing recent diagnosis a-fib. negative side effect involved feet little cold times remedied putting pair sox.
full_review: After a diagnosis of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy the drug has relaxed my heart muscle allowing it to pump blood better and also eliminated or lowered the extra heart beats that I experienced. It may also assist in treating or managing my recent diagnosis of A-Fib. Only negative side effect involved my feet being a little cold at times but that was remedied by putting on a pair of sox.

review: want know i’m alone this!! went clinic feeling bad took blood pressure high covid september went back eye infection, took blood pressure, high went different doctor prescribed lisinopril taking days gave tachycardia told stop prescribed metoprolol oh goodness took days it’s worst, started feeling dizzy pulse getting really low talking doctor told stop taking however it’s month since still feel dizzy pulse still low specially night, goes sometimes i’m scared..worst thing best depending see blood pressure normal! i’m mad feeling fine took medicine make feel way! :(
full_review: I just want to know I’m not alone in this!! I went to the clinic because I was feeling bad and when they took my blood pressure it was high but it was because I had COVID but on September I went back because I had an eye infection, when they took my blood pressure, again it was high so I went with a different doctor and she prescribed lisinopril which after taking it 6 days gave me tachycardia so she told me to stop it and then she prescribed me metoprolol oh my goodness I took it for 4 days and it’s been the worst, I started feeling dizzy and my pulse was getting really low so talking to a doctor he told me to stop taking it however it’s been a month since that and I still feel dizzy and my pulse is still low specially at night, it goes down to 48 sometimes and I’m scared..worst thing or best depending how you see it is that my blood pressure is normal! I’m so mad because I was feeling fine it only took a medicine to make me feel this way! :(

review: taken metoprolol months noticed wasn’t good job blood pressure control bystolic increased dosage compensate side effects started. anxiety unreal! treated afib soon cryoblation afib back. really think reading reviews metoprolol blame days back bystolic still anxiety palpitations seem slowly subsiding. don’t use blood pressure medication want keep sanity. also want note extreme trouble sleeping metoprolol. i’m never trying beta blocker bystolic.
full_review: I had taken Metoprolol for months and noticed it wasn’t doing as good a job at blood pressure control as Bystolic and then as I increased the dosage to compensate the side effects started. The anxiety was unreal! I had been treated for afib and soon after Cryoblation the afib was back. I really think after reading these reviews that the Metoprolol is to blame. I have been off of it now 2 days and am back on Bystolic and still have some anxiety and palpitations but they seem to be slowly subsiding. Don’t use this blood pressure medication if want to keep your sanity. I also want to note that I had extreme trouble sleeping while on Metoprolol. I’m never trying any other beta blocker but Bystolic.

review: started metoprolol twice per day years ago high bp chest pain. past month started getting pvc chest pain along low blood pressure averaging around lay goes even lower stay sleepy feel flutters. scary. cardio dr bunch test wish would figure quickly causing severe anxiety. im worried diminished cardiac output. got afraid go sleep. wondering better med metoprolol pvc wont drop bp low? clearly dont need bp going lower.
full_review: I started on metoprolol 25mg twice per day about 3 years ago for high BP and chest pain. In the past month I have started getting PVC and chest pain along with very low blood pressure averaging around 9565 and when I lay down it goes even lower I stay so sleepy and can feel the flutters. Its very scary. My cardio Dr is doing a bunch of test on me but I wish he would figure this out quickly its causing me severe anxiety. Im so worried that now I have diminished cardiac output. Its got me afraid to go to sleep. I was wondering is there a better med other than metoprolol for PVC that wont drop my bp so low? I clearly dont need my bp going any lower.

review: mitral valve replacement weeks starting getting shortness breath doctors said part healing process, dizziness confusion, numbness feet hands. kept complaining cardiologists nurse called said quit taking metoprolol quit cold turkey days quitting started bad withdrawal systems tingling feet top head. month now, neuropathy shortness breath, pray god get better. better days, doesnt last. breath little better go away quickly, nobody give answers, wish would researched lot sooner metoprolol sussinate days , would never take drug again. sure helps lot people dissatisfied, maybe take months get nervous system fatty tissue.
full_review: I had a mitral valve replacement After about 6 weeks starting getting shortness of breath doctors said part of healing process, then dizziness confusion, then numbness in feet and hands.  I  kept complaining cardiologists nurse called and said quit taking Metoprolol they had me quit cold turkey.  Then 4 days after quitting I  started having bad withdrawal systems tingling from feet to top of head.  It has been a month now, I  have neuropathy and shortness of breath, pray to God it it will get better. I do have some better days, but doesnt last.  I can breath a little better it can go away quickly, nobody can give me answers, wish I would have researched a lot sooner.  I was on 25mg metoprolol sussinate 80 days , would never take this drug again.  I am sure it helps a lot of people but not me very dissatisfied, maybe it will take a few months to get out of my nervous system and fatty tissue.

review: drug two years, side effects are, tired even sleep, panic attacks, depression, cant stand around people, vision bad. talk lose train thought, remember peoples names, im lightheaded, dizzy, hair falling handful, loss interest life knew it. dose take day. guess may keeping alive. put widow maker heart attack years ago, year ago another stent..

When I talk I lose my train of thought, I can remember peoples names, Im lightheaded, dizzy, my hair is falling out by handful,  I have loss all interest in life as I knew it.
